original: itarā api pañcadaśakalā divasavyavahāropayoginyaḥ kṣayodayavatyaḥ pañcadaśatithayo bhavantīti tithayaḥ ṣoḍaśaivetyaviruddhaṃ vacanamiti /
analyzed: itarāḥ api pañcadaśa kalāḥ divasa vyavahāra upayoginyaḥ kṣaya udayavatyaḥ pañcadaśa tithayaḥ bhavanti iti tithayaḥ ṣoḍaśa eva iti aviruddham vacanam iti
translated: The other fifteen kalās, useful for the practice of the day, are the fifteen lunar days subject to waning and waxing. Thus, the statement that there are only sixteen lunar days is not contradictory.

analyzed: ama ādi paurṇamāsī antāḥ yāḥ eva śaśinaḥ kalāḥ
translated: Those very kalās of the moon, from the new moon to the full moon,

analyzed: tithayaḥ tāḥ samākhyātāḥ ṣoḍaśa eva varānane
translated: Are called lunar days, O beautiful one, they are sixteen only.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśanmate pi
translated: In the Ṣaṭtriṃśanmata also:

original: tatra pakṣāvubhau māse śuklakṛṣṇau krameṇa hi /
analyzed: tatra pakṣau ubhau māse śukla kṛṣṇau krameṇa hi
translated: There, in each month, the two fortnights are the bright and dark fortnights, in order.
The bright fortnight increases the moon, and the dark fortnight is characterized by the waning of the moon.

analyzed: pakṣati ādyāḥ tu tithayaḥ kramāt pañcadaśa smṛtāḥ
translated: The lunar days beginning with the first are known to be fifteen in order.

analyzed: darśa antāḥ kṛṣṇapakṣe tāḥ pūrṇimā antāḥ ca śuklake
translated: They end with the new moon in the dark fortnight, and with the full moon in the bright fortnight.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: sā ca tithirdvividhā pūrṇā khaṇḍā ca /
analyzed: sā ca tithiḥ dvividhā pūrṇā khaṇḍā ca
translated: And that lunar day is of two kinds: full and partial.

analyzed: tatra udayam ārabhya udaya paryantā pūrṇā
translated: There, beginning from sunrise to sunrise, it is full.

analyzed: āditya udaya velāyāḥ ārabhya ṣaṣṭi nāḍikāḥ
translated: From the time of sunrise, sixty nāḍikās

analyzed: sampūrṇāḥ iti vikhyātāḥ
translated: are well-known as complete.

analyzed: iti nāradīya ukteḥ
translated: Thus it is stated in the Nāradīya.

analyzed: pratipad prabhṛtayaḥ sarvāḥ udayāt ā udayāt raveḥ
translated: All lunar days beginning with the first, from sunrise to sunrise,

analyzed: sampūrṇāḥ iti vikhyātāḥ hari vāsara varjitāḥ
translated: are well-known as complete, except on Hari's day.

analyzed: iti skānda ukteḥ ca
translated: Thus it is stated in the Skanda.

original: kecittu udayādastamayaparyantāyā api sampūrṇatvaṃ dinamātrasādhyeṣu bhāvati /
analyzed: kecid tu udayāt astamaya paryantāyāḥ api sampūrṇa tvam dina mātra sādhyeṣu
translated: But some say that even a lunar day that lasts from sunrise to sunset is complete for rites that can be accomplished in a day alone.

original: trisandhyavyāpinī yā tu saiva pūjyā sadā tithiḥ /
analyzed: trisandhya vyāpinī yā tu sā eva pūjyā sadā tithiḥ
translated: The lunar day that extends over the three junctions is always to be worshipped.

analyzed: na tatra yugma ādaraṇam anyatra harivāsarāt
translated: There, the evenness of the day is not to be considered, except on Hari's day.

analyzed: iti parāśara vacanāt
translated: Thus it is stated by Parāśara.

analyzed: tri sandhyā vyāpinī prātar madhyāhna sāyaṃsandhyā vyāpinī
translated: Extending over the three junctions means extending over the junctions of morning, midday, and evening.

original: na tu prātaḥsandhyādvayaṃ sāyaṃsandhyā ceti /🔽saṅkhayāyāḥ pṛthaktvaniveśitvāttisra āhutīrjuhotiitivat /
analyzed: na tu prātaḥsandhyā dvayam sāyaṃsandhyā ca iti  saṅkhayāyāḥ pṛthaktva niveśi tvāt tisraḥ āhutīḥ juhoti itivat
translated: But not that the morning has two sandhyas and the evening has one sandhya.🔽Because number is not included separately, like in he offers three oblations.

analyzed: trisandhyam yaḥ paṭhet ityādau tathā vyutpatteḥ ca
translated: And because of the derivation in such expressions as he who recites at the three sandhyas.

analyzed: tasmāt ahar mātra sādhyeṣu tanmātra vyāpini api sampūrṇe ti āhuḥ
translated: Therefore, in those that are accomplished in a day alone, even though it extends over that alone, they say it is complete.

analyzed: sampūrṇā itarā khaṇḍā
translated: The incomplete one is partial.

original: tatra sampūrṇā ekadinamātre sattvāttattithiprayuktasya kāryasya itaradine prasakteḥ sandehābhāvānna nirṇeyā /
analyzed: tatra sampūrṇā eka dina mātre sattvāt tad tithi prayuktasya kāryasya itara dine prasakteḥ sandeha abhāvāt na nirṇeyā
translated: There, the complete one is to be decided because it exists for one day only, and there is no doubt due to the possibility of the rite employed on that date on the next day.

original: khaṇḍā tu dinadveye sattvāt guṇānurodhena ca pradhānāvṛtteranyāyyatvena tatprayuktasya kāryasya sakṛdanuṣṭeyatvāt vka tadanuṣṭhānamiti sandehānnirṇeyā 🔽bhavati /
analyzed: khaṇḍā tu dina dveye sattvāt guṇa anurodhena ca pradhāna āvṛtteḥ anyāyya tvena tad prayuktasya kāryasya sakṛt anuṣṭeya tvāt tat anuṣṭhānam iti sandehāt nirṇeyā  / bhavati
translated: But the partial one is to be decided because it exists for two days, and due to the impropriety of the repetition of the primary rite in accordance with the subordinate factor, the rite employed by it is to be performed only once, so there is doubt about when to perform it.

original: niṣedhe tu khaṇḍāpyanirṇeyaiva /🔽nimittaṃ kālamādāya vṛttirvidhiniṣedhayoḥ /🔽vidhiḥ pūjyatithau tatra niṣedhaḥ kālamātrake //
analyzed: niṣedhe tu khaṇḍā api anirṇeyā eva  nimittam kālam ādāya vṛttiḥ vidhi niṣedhayoḥ  vidhiḥ pūjya tithau tatra niṣedhaḥ kāla mātrake
translated: But in prohibition, even the partial one is to be decided.🔽The application of injunctions and prohibitions takes place on the basis of the occasion, time.🔽The injunction is on the worshipped date there, the prohibition is on the mere time.

analyzed: tithīnām pūjya tā nāma karma anuṣṭhāna yogya tā
translated: The worshipped dates are fit for the performance of rites.

analyzed: niṣedhaḥ tu nivṛttya ātmā kāla mātram apekṣate
translated: But prohibition has the nature of cessation and requires only time.

analyzed: iti vṛddha gārgya ukteḥ
translated: Thus it is said by Vṛddhagārgya.

original: atra kālasya nimittatvaṃ nāmānupādeyatvaṃ na tu vāstavanimittatvaṃ sarvasya karmaṇo naimittikatvāpatteḥ /
analyzed: atra kālasya nimitta tvam nāma anupādeya tvam na tu vāstava nimitta tvam sarvasya karmaṇaḥ naimittika tva āpatteḥ
translated: Here, the causal nature of time means not being subsidiary, but not real causality, because then all action would be occasional.

analyzed: na ca iṣṭa āpattiḥ
translated: And it is not to be assumed.

original: amāvāsyāyāṃ pitṛbhyo dadyādityādau tatra tatra saptamyādibhiraṅgatvāvagateḥ /
analyzed: amāvāsyāyām pitṛbhyaḥ dadyāt ityādau tatra tatra saptamī ādibhiḥ aṅga tva avagateḥ
translated: In passages like One should give to the ancestors on the new moon day, the subsidiary nature is understood by the locative case ending and so on.

analyzed: na ca sā api nimitta saptamī eva iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that this is only the locative case of the cause.

analyzed: upapada vibhaktitaḥ kāraka vibhakteḥ balīyaḥ tvāt
translated: Because the case ending denoting the instrument is stronger than the case ending denoting the locative of the preceding word.

analyzed: na ca evam sarva vyāpi kāmya tva āpattiḥ akaraṇe pratyavāya śravaṇa ādinā naimittika tvāt
translated: And thus it is not to be assumed that it becomes all-pervading, because it is not occasional due to the mention of a curse in the case of non-performance.

original: na caivaṃ yatra vīpsāmātraśravaṇaṃ tatra nimittaparatvameva syānna kāmye kālaparateti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam yatra vīpsā mātra śravaṇam tatra nimitta paratvam eva syāt na kāmye kāla paratā iti vācyam
translated: And thus it should not be said that where only the distributive is heard, there it would be only about the cause, not about the desired time.

analyzed: nimitta tvena eva śrutasya api kālasya upasthita tvāt aṅga tvena api bodhaka abhāvāt iti kecid
translated: Some say that even though time is heard as the cause, it is understood as a subsidiary due to its being present and the absence of any other indicator.

original: vastuto naivopasthitasyāpi tasya kāmye prayoge grahaṇaṃ bārhadgirādivat kintvanyasyaiva yasya kasya cit /
analyzed: vastutas nā eva upasthitasya api tasya kāmye prayoge grahaṇam bārhadgira ādi vat kintu anyasya eva yasya kasya cit
translated: In reality, even though it is not present, it is grasped in the performance of what is desired, like the Bārhadgīra and so on, but of someone else, of anyone at all.

original: jyotiṣṭome tu vīpsārahitena vākyāntareṇa vasantaprāptirityanyatra vistaraḥ /
analyzed: jyotiṣṭome tu vīpsā rahitena vākya antareṇa vasanta prāptiḥ iti anyatra vistaraḥ
translated: But in the Jyotiṣṭoma, the attainment of spring is by another sentence devoid of the distributive, as explained elsewhere in detail.

analyzed: niṣedhaḥ kāla mātraka
translated: The prohibition is merely temporal.

original: ityayaṃ na vācaniko 'rthaḥ kintu nyāyaprāpta ityāhaniṣedhastvityādinā /
analyzed: iti ayam na vācanikaḥ rthaḥ kintu nyāya prāptaḥ iti āha niṣedhaḥ tu ityādinā
translated: This is not the verbal meaning, but what is obtained by reasoning. He says this with But the prohibition, etc.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is this.

analyzed: vidhi vākyeṣu vidheya arthasya śreyaḥ sādhana tvam vākya arthaḥ
translated: In injunctions, the meaning of what is to be enjoined is the means to what is to be accomplished.

analyzed: niṣedheṣu tu kāla viśeṣe rāga prāptasya anartha hetu tvam
translated: But in prohibitions, what is obtained by passion at a particular time is the cause of harm.

original: evaṃ ca ṣaṣṭhīṣu tailamityādau ṣaṣṭhyāṃ tailābhyaṅgakaraṇe 'narthaprasakteravagaterdvinadvaye 'pi ṣaṣṭhyāṃ tanniṣedha iti /
analyzed: evam ca ṣaṣṭhīṣu tailam ityādau ṣaṣṭhyām taila abhyaṅga karaṇe nartha prasakteḥ avagateḥ dvi na dvaye ṣaṣṭhyām tad niṣedhaḥ iti
translated: And thus, in oil on the sixth etc., when the application of oil on the sixth is understood as leading to harm, the prohibition of that is on any of the two sixths.

original: tasmādyāvattithibāvitvena niṣedhasya nirṇītatvānniṣedheṣu khaṇḍā na nirṇeyeti siddham /
analyzed: tasmāt yāvat tithi bāvi tvena niṣedhasya nirṇīta tvāt niṣedheṣu khaṇḍā na nirṇeyā iti siddham
translated: Therefore, since the prohibition is determined as being based on the lunar day, it is established that in prohibitions, the lunar day is not to be determined.

analyzed: na ca evam sarva niṣedhānām nyāyāt eva tātkālika tva siddhau
translated: And thus, since the temporariness of all prohibitions is established by reasoning itself,

analyzed: abhyaṅge ca udadhi snāne danta dhāvana maithune
translated: And in anointing, bathing in the ocean, cleaning the teeth, sexual intercourse,

original: jāte ca maraṇe caiva tatkālavyāpinī tithiḥ //
analyzed: jāte ca maraṇe ca eva tad kāla vyāpinī tithiḥ
translated: in birth and in death, the lunar day extends up to that time.

analyzed: iti skānde abhyaṅga ādau punarvacana ānarthakyam iti vācyam
translated: Thus in the Skanda (Purana). It should be said that the repetition in anointing etc. is meaningless.

original: manvādau ca yugādau ca grahaṇe candrasūryayoḥ /
analyzed: manu ādau ca yuga ādau ca grahaṇe candra sūryayoḥ
translated: And in the beginning of the Manvantara, in the beginning of the Yuga, in the lunar and solar eclipses,

original: vyatīpāte vaidhutau ca tatkālavyāpinī kriyā //🔽iti skānda eva manvādau tatkālavyāpitvavidhānastutyarthaṃ dṛṣṭāntatayā tadupādānāt /
analyzed: vyatīpāte vaidhutau ca tad kāla vyāpinī kriyā  iti skānde eva manu ādau tad kāla vyāpi tva vidhāna stuti artham dṛṣṭānta tayā tad upādānāt
translated: in the Vyatīpāta and Vaidhṛti, the rite extends up to that time.🔽Thus in the Skanda (Purana) itself, the mention of that in the Manvantara etc. is for the purpose of praising the injunction that it should extend up to that time, as an example.

analyzed: tad kāla vyāpinī tithiḥ iti asya ayam arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of this is:

analyzed: teṣām abhyaṅga ādīnām kālam anuṣṭhāna kālam vyāpnotu adhikaraṇa tvena iti
translated: Let the lunar day extend to the time of those anointing etc., as the basis.

original: kecittu abhyaṅgādiṣu vi hiteṣveva tatkālavyāpinī tithiranena vacanenoktetyāhuḥ /
analyzed: kecid tu abhyaṅga ādiṣu vi hiteṣu eva tad kāla vyāpinī tithiḥ anena vacanena uktā iti āhuḥ
translated: But some say that the lunar day extending up to that time is stated by this statement only in the enjoined anointing etc.

analyzed: tat asat
translated: That is wrong.

analyzed: danta dhāvana maithunayoḥ tithi viśeṣeṣu vidheḥ adarśanāt niṣedha darśanāt ca iti tatra khajḍāyām api
translated: Because there is no injunction of cleaning the teeth and sexual intercourse on specific lunar days, and because there is a prohibition (of them on specific lunar days), even there (in the Skanda Purana),

original: tattadaharbhāgarūpakālavihiteṣu karmasu tattadaharbhāgarūpakā lavyāpinī eva tithirgrāhyā /
analyzed: tad tad ahar bhāga rūpa kāla vihiteṣu karmasu tad tad ahar bhāga rūpa kā la vyāpinī eva tithiḥ grāhyā
translated: in the rites enjoined for the time in the form of that and that part of the day, the lunar day extending up to that and that part of the day should be taken.

analyzed: karmaṇaḥ yasya yaḥ kālaḥ tad kāla vyāpinī tithiḥ
translated: The lunar day that extends up to the time of a particular rite,

original: tayā karmāṇi kurvīta hāsavṛddhī na kāraṇam //
analyzed: tayā karmāṇi kurvīta hāsa vṛddhī na kāraṇam
translated: one should perform the rites with that, the increase or decrease of the moon is not the cause.

analyzed: iti vṛddha gājñavalkya ukteḥ
translated: Thus it is stated by Vṛddhagāñgavalkya.

analyzed: ahar bhāga rūpaḥ karma kālaḥ ca prātar saṅgava madhyāhna aparāhla sāyāhna rūpa svi muhūrta ātmakaḥ
translated: The time for rites, which is in the form of a part of the day, consists of the three muhūrtas of morning, midday, and afternoon, in the form of morning, midday, afternoon, and evening.

analyzed: lekhā prabhṛti atha ādityāt muhūrtāḥ trayaḥ eva ca
translated: Then, from the time of writing, there are only three muhūrtas before sunrise.

original: prātastu sesmṛtaḥ kālo bhāgaścāhnaḥ sa pañcamaḥ //
analyzed: prātar tu sa ismṛtaḥ kālaḥ bhāgaḥ ca ahnaḥ sa pañcamaḥ
translated: The time before sunrise is considered the fifth part of the day.

analyzed: madhyāhnaḥ tad samaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Three muhūrtas is midday, and it is considered equal to that.

analyzed: tatas trayaḥ muhūrtāḥ ca aparāhṇaḥ vidhīyate
translated: Then, the three muhūrtas after that are designated as the afternoon.

original: pañcamo 'tha dināṃśo yaḥ sa sāyāhna iti smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: dina aṃśaḥ yaḥ sa sāyāhnaḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: The fifth part of the day that is left is known as the evening.

analyzed: yat yat eteṣu vihitam tat tat kuryāt vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The wise one should perform whatever is prescribed during these times.

analyzed: iti parāśara ukteḥ
translated: Thus it is stated by Parāśara.

original: yastudvedhā tredhā vibhāgaḥ sa yatra karmaviśeṣe vihitastatra grāhyaḥ tasminnasati tu pañcadhāvibhāga eveti dharmaśāstravidaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu dvedhā tredhā vibhāgaḥ sa yatra karma viśeṣe vihitaḥ tatra grāhyaḥ tasmin asati tu pañcadhā vibhāgaḥ eva iti dharma śāstra vidaḥ
translated: The learned in Dharmaśāstra say that the division into two or three parts should be accepted in those specific rites where it is prescribed, but if that is not the case, then the division into five parts alone is to be followed.

analyzed: teṣām ca ayam āśavaḥ
translated: And their view is this:

original: atra hi yadyadeteṣu vihitaṃ tattadatra kurvāditi na vidherya vidhita eva tatsiddheḥ /
analyzed: atra hi yat yat eteṣu vihitam tat tat atra kurvāt iti na vidheḥ yaḥ vidhitaḥ eva tad siddheḥ
translated: For here, whatever is enjoined among these, that is to be done here, but not by injunction, because that is established by the injunction itself.

original: kintu yadyadyadvihitaṃ kālāpekṣaṃ tattadeteṣviti vidhīyatemaitrāvaruṇaḥ preṣyati cānvāhaitivadapekṣitārthavidheḥ tena sāmānyavidhirayamiti
analyzed: kintu yat yat yat vihitam kāla apekṣam tat tat eteṣu iti vidhīyate maitrāvaruṇaḥ preṣyati ca anvāha eti vat apekṣita artha vidheḥ tena sāmānya vidhiḥ ayam iti
translated: But whatever is enjoined in relation to time, that is enjoined among these, like the Maitravaruna recites and directs. Thus this is a general injunction.

analyzed: idam ca upavāsāt anyatra tasya ahar rātra sādhya tvāt iti vakṣyate
translated: And this will be said to be other than fasting, because that is accomplished in a day and night.

original: tataśca pūrvedyureva karmakālavyāptau ekadeśasambandhe vā pūrvaiva ādye kālaśāstralābhāt dvitīye kālamātralābhāt /
analyzed: tatas ca pūrvedyus eva karma kāla vyāptau eka deśa sambandhe vā pūrvā eva ādye kāla śāstra lābhāt dvitīye kāla mātra lābhāt
translated: And therefore, if the time of the rite extends to the previous day or is connected to a part, the previous one is the first, because the time is obtained from the treatise, and in the second, only the time is obtained.

analyzed: atas eva paratra eva tathātve parā eva
translated: And for that very reason, if it is so only in the later one, the later one is.

analyzed: dina dvaye vaiṣamyeṇa sambandhe yā adhikā sā eva
translated: If there is a connection with the two days with inequality, the one with the excess is that one.

original: sāmyenaikadeśasambandhe tu yatkarma prātarupakramya prātareva samāpyate tatra pradhānopakramakālīnā grāhyā /🔽yo yasya vihitaḥ kālaḥ karmaṇastadupakrame /
analyzed: sāmyena eka deśa sambandhe tu yat karma prātar upakramya prātar eva samāpyate tatra pradhāna upakrama kālīnā grāhyā  yaḥ yasya vihitaḥ kālaḥ karmaṇaḥ tad upakrame
translated: But if there is a connection with a part with equality, then in that rite which is begun in the morning and completed in the morning, the one at the time of the commencement of the principal rite is to be taken.

analyzed: tithiḥ yā abhimatā sā tu kāryā na upakrama ujjhitā
translated: The lunar day that is desired for a rite should be performed at its commencement, not abandoned.

analyzed: iti baudhāyana ukteḥ na atra yugma vākya pravṛttiḥ
translated: Because it is stated by Baudhayana, there is no application of the dual statement here.

analyzed: yat tu
translated: But it is said:

analyzed: karma pūrvam upakramya madhyāhna ādau samāpyate
translated: Having begun the ritual earlier, it is completed at midday or later.

analyzed: tatra vakṣyamāṇa yugma vākya ādi pravṛttiḥ evam ca iti utsargaḥ
translated: There, the application of the dual statement and so on that will be mentioned is like this, if the state extends over two days. This is the general rule.

original: madanaratnastu sāmyena vaiṣamyeṇa vā dinadvaya ekadeśasambandhe 'pi yadyekatraivānuṣṭhānaparyāptaḥ kālastadā tatraiva yadyubhayatra tadā yugmavā 🔽kyādinā nirṇayaḥ /
analyzed: madanaratnaḥ tu sāmyena vaiṣamyeṇa vā dina dvaye eka deśa sambandhe yadi ekatra eva anuṣṭhāna paryāptaḥ kālaḥ tadā tatra eva yadi ubhayatra tadā  kya ādinā nirṇayaḥ
translated: But Madanaratna says that even if there is connection with one part of two days, whether equally or unequally, if the time is sufficient for performance at one place only, then by the dual statement etc. the decision is made.

original: yadi nobhayatra kintu karmaikadeśasambandhastatrāpi yadi samastadopakramavākyāt yadi viṣamastadādhikyenetyāha /
analyzed: yadi nā ubhayatra kintu karma eka deśa sambandhaḥ tatra api yadi samaḥ tadā upakrama vākyāt yadi viṣamaḥ tadā ādhikyena iti āha
translated: If it is not at both places, but is connected with one part of the ritual, even there, if the beginning statement is complete, and if it is unequal, then by the excess, he says.

analyzed: atha yat yugma vākya ādi nirṇāyakam tat ucyate
translated: Now, if it is said that which determines the dual statement etc., it is said.

analyzed: yugma vākyam tāvat nigame
translated: First, the dual statement is in the Vedas:

analyzed: yugma agni yuga bhūtānām ṣaṣ munyoḥ vasu randhrayoḥ

analyzed: mādhava āpastamba bhāṣya artha saṅgraha kāra ādayaḥ tu pūrva udāhṛta taittirīya aitareyi vākyābhyām āpastamba āsvalāyana śākhinām aparāhṇa sandhau candra darśana  eva yāgaḥ

translated: For this very reason, having begun with the full moon,

translated: If the Iṣṭi is completed when the Pratipad has just entered,

analyzed: atha vikṛteḥ

analyzed: revatī ca

analyzed: ca janakaḥ tatas sarveṣām anadhikāra prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If the natural occurrence of the form causes impurity, then all are not entitled.

original: kiṃ bahunā buddhipūrvakārī balānnimittaṃ sampādya na ko 'pi duḥkhākare snānādau pravartteteti sakalo vidhirapramāṇīkṛtaḥ syāt /
analyzed: kim bahunā buddhi pūrva kārī balāt nimittam sampādya na kaḥ duḥkha ākare snāna ādau pravartteta iti sakalaḥ vidhiḥ apramāṇīkṛtaḥ syāt
translated: What more? No one would engage in bathing etc. that causes suffering, having accomplished the cause by force, having acted with intelligence, so the entire injunction would be discredited.

original: kiñca saṅkrame pūrvottarakālayoḥ puṇyatvam uparāge tu yāvaddarśanaviṣayatā tāvadeva /
analyzed: kiñca saṅkrame pūrva uttara kālayoḥ puṇya tvam uparāge tu yāvat darśana viṣaya tā tāvat eva
translated: Moreover, in the case of a Saṅkrānti, merit accrues both before and after the time, but in the case of an Upavāsa, it lasts only as long as it is within the range of vision.

analyzed: cākṣuṣa jñāna viṣaya tā sama kālam snāna ādi anuṣṭheyam iti arthaḥ sampadyate
translated: The meaning that emerges is that bathing etc. should be performed simultaneously with the object of visual knowledge.

analyzed: na ca etat sambhavati darśana snānayoḥ ūrdhva adhas mukha sādhya tvena virodhāt
translated: And this is not possible, because of the contradiction between seeing and bathing, which are to be accomplished with the face up and down respectively.

original: na ca dṛśerbhramapramāsādhāraṇatvājjale pratibimbabhramavataḥ sa evāyaṃ candra iti bimbapratyabhijñāpramāvato vā snānāvirodha iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca dṛśeḥ bhrama pramā sādhāraṇa tvāt jale pratibimba bhramavataḥ saḥ eva ayam candraḥ iti bimba pratyabhijñā pramāvataḥ vā snāna avirodhaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that there is no contradiction in bathing for one who has the illusion of a reflection in the water, thinking This is the moon, or for one who has the valid cognition of recognizing the orb, thinking This is the same moon, because of the commonality of illusion and valid cognition in seeing.

analyzed: śrāddha ādi virodhasya duṣparihara tvāt
translated: Because the contradiction with Śrāddha etc. is difficult to avoid.

analyzed: na uparaktam na vāri stham iti niṣedhāt ca
translated: And because of the prohibition: Not reddened, not in water.

original: ata eva nopaghātāgnivaddarśa naviśiṣṭa uparāgo nimittaṃ pūrvoktadoṣānativṛtteḥ /
analyzed: atas eva na upaghāta agni vat darśa na viśiṣṭaḥ uparāgaḥ nimittam pūrva ukta doṣa anativṛtteḥ
translated: For the same reason, an Upavāsa qualified by seeing is not the cause, like the fire of destruction, because it does not transcend the previously mentioned faults.

analyzed: viśiṣṭa uddeśe vākya bhedāt ca
translated: And because there would be a split of the sentence if a qualified object were specified.

original: na coddeśyaviśeṣaṇaṃ darśanaṃ vivakṣitaṃ havirubhayatvavadavi vakṣitatvāt /
analyzed: na ca uddeśya viśeṣaṇam darśanam vivakṣitam haviḥ ubhaya tva vat avi vakṣita tvāt
translated: And seeing is not intended as a qualifier of the object, like the duality of the oblation, because it is not intended.

original: nanvitthaṃ vyākulayato darśanasya māstu nimittatvaṃ kintu nīhārakarttṛkasandhyāharaṇe
analyzed: nanu ittham vyākulayataḥ darśanasya mā astu nimitta tvam kintu nīhāra karttṛka sandhyā haraṇe
translated: Now, in this way, let the vision, which causes confusion, not be the cause, but rather, in the removal of twilight by the one who causes mist,

original: darśanaviśaiṣṭajapavidhivaduparāga eva nimitte darśanaviśiṣṭaṃ snānādi tattadvākyavihitasnānādyanuvādena
analyzed: darśana viśā iṣṭa japa vidhi vat uparāge eva nimitte darśana viśiṣṭam snāna ādi tad tad vākya vihita snāna ādi anuvādena
translated: like the injunction to recite the specific vision, the specific vision of bathing etc. is only the cause. The bathing etc. enjoined by those respective statements are restated.

analyzed: darśana mātram vā vidhīyate
translated: Either the mere vision is enjoined.

original: nimittaniścayastu bhavadiṣṭa evāstu /🔽naimittikasvarūpālocanenaiva cāndhodinivṛttiḥ ekaikāgnyādināśa ivāgnyādhānasya bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: nimitta niścayaḥ tu bhavat iṣṭaḥ evā astu  naimittika svarūpa ālocanena eva ca andha udi nivṛttiḥ ekaika agni ādi nāśaḥ iva agnyādhānasya bhaviṣyati
translated: But let the ascertainment of the cause be just as desired.🔽And the cessation of the blind day will be by the mere consideration of the nature of the obligatory act, just as the re-establishment of the sacred fire is by the destruction of each fire.

analyzed: atha vā avagate ṅga tve dṛṣṭārtha tvāt āruṇyasya eka hāyanī paricchedaka tayā iva darśanasya eva nimitta niścaya tvena adhikāra sampādana upayogi tā bhaviṣyati
translated: Or, when the subsidiary nature is understood, the determination of the cause by the vision itself, like the determination of the one-year-old cow, will be useful in accomplishing the eligibility.

original: noparaktamityādiniṣedhasya vaidhe 'pravṛtternāśucī rāhutārakā iti niṣedhasyai tanmate darśanottaraṃ pravṛtteḥ sarveṣāmadhikāro bhaviṣyatīti
analyzed: na uparaktam ityādi niṣedhasya vaidhe pravṛtteḥ na aśucī rāhu tārakāḥ iti tad mate darśana uttaram pravṛtteḥ sarveṣām adhikāraḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: And because the prohibition beginning with not reddened is not engaged in the injunction, and because the prohibition not impure, Rahu, stars is engaged after the vision according to that view, all will have eligibility.

original: yukto 'yaṃ panthā iti cet / na yuktaḥ /
analyzed: yuktaḥ yam panthāḥ iti ced na yuktaḥ
translated: If it is said that this path is proper, it is not proper.

analyzed: tatra tāvat na darśana śabdaḥ cākṣuṣa jñāna vacanaḥ ṣaḍ darśanāni yājñika darśanam ityādeḥ niścaya mātre pi abhiyukta prayogāt
translated: There, the word 'darśana' does not denote visual cognition, because learned people use it for mere seeing, as in 'the six darśanas', 'the Yajnika darśana', and so on.

analyzed: ātmā vāre draṣṭavyā eti śruteḥ ca
translated: And because of the Vedic text 'The Self is to be seen'.

analyzed: saḥ īkṣāñcakre ikṣateḥ nośabdam iti īśvara jñānasya dṛśi artha īkṣatinā abhidhānāt ca
translated: And because the word 'īkṣate' (sees) is used for the knowledge of God, as in 'He desired to see'.

analyzed: aitareye pi
translated: In the Aitareya Upanishad also,

original: ṛtā vā yasya rodasī iti śaṃsati cakṣurvākṣataṃ tasmādyataro vivadamānayorāhāhamanuṣṭayā cakṣuṣādarśamiti tasya śraddadhati /
analyzed: ṛtā vā yasya rodasī iti śaṃsati cakṣuḥ vā akṣatam tasmāt yataraḥ vivadamānayoḥ āha aham anuṣṭayā cakṣuṣā adarśam iti tasya śraddadhati
translated: it is said 'Whose two worlds are true', and 'The eye is not destroyed. Therefore, when two people are disputing and one says I saw with my own eyes, they believe him.'

analyzed: iti atra cakṣuḥ grahaṇa ānarthakyāt ca
translated: And because the mention of the eye is meaningless in this passage.

analyzed: adarśam iti etāvatā eva cākṣuṣa jñāna lābhāt ittham bhūta lakṣaṇe tṛtīyā vidhānāt chātreṇa upādhyāyam adrākṣīt iti udāharaṇāt
translated: And because the visual cognition is obtained just by saying 'I saw', and because the instrumental case is used in the sense of 'being in such a state', as in the example 'The student saw the teacher'.

analyzed: tasmāt jñāna mātram api dṛśi arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning of 'dṛśya' is mere knowledge.

analyzed: atas eva  rajasaḥ darśane nārī tri rātram aśuciḥ bhavet
translated: For this very reason,

analyzed: iti dharma śāstram
translated: in the Dharmashastras it is said: 'If a woman sees semen, she becomes impure for three nights.'

analyzed: cākṣuṣa prayoga prācuryam tu pūrva pūrva prayogāt go śabdasya iva paśu gavi
translated: And the predominance of the use of the word 'darśana' in the visual sense is due to the prior use of the word 'darśana', just as the word 'go' (cow) is used for both an animal and a village.

original: astu vā cākṣuṣajñānavācitā tathāpi na darśane vidhiḥ sambhavati tasya pakṣaprāptatve 'pūrvavidhyasambhavāt /
analyzed: astu vā cākṣuṣa jñāna vāci tā tathā api na darśane vidhiḥ sambhavati tasya pakṣa prāpta tve pūrva vidhi asambhavāt
translated: Or let it be that the word refers to visual cognition, even so, an injunction is not possible in regard to seeing, because when that is already established by the general rule, an injunction of what is new is not possible.

analyzed: aneka uddeśena vidhāne vākya bhedāt ca
translated: Or if there is an injunction with reference to many, there would be a split of the sentence.

analyzed: atha darśana niyama viśiṣṭa snāna ādi vidhīyate iti matam
translated: Now, if the view is that the bathing etc. qualified by the restriction on seeing is enjoined,

analyzed: tathā api nā andha ādi nivṛttiḥ suvacā
translated: even so, the exclusion of the blind etc. is not easily stated.

analyzed: tān prati api naimittika vidhi pravṛtteḥ
translated: Because even in their case, the injunction of the occasional rite comes into operation.

original: na hi kāmya iva naimittikeṣu sarvāṅgopasaṃhāraḥ nimittatvavyāghātāt /
analyzed: na hi kāmye iva naimittikeṣu sarva aṅga upasaṃhāraḥ nimitta tva vyāghātāt
translated: For, unlike in the optional rites, in the occasional rites, there is no inclusion of all the parts, because that would be contrary to the nature of the occasion.

analyzed: tat eva hi nimittam yat sva sattāyām avaśyam anuṣṭhāpayati
translated: For, that alone is the occasion which necessarily causes the performance in its own existence.
Because what does not cause performance cannot be an occasion.

original: na hi sarvadā sarvaḥ sāṅgamanuṣṭhātuṃ samarthaḥ /
analyzed: na hi sarvadā sarvaḥ sa aṅgam anuṣṭhātum samarthaḥ
translated: For, everyone is not always able to perform with all the parts, as in the optional rites.

original: tasmāt kiñcidaṅgahānenāpi naimittikādhikārādandhādīnāṃ meghacchanne vā darśanarūpāṅgalope 'pi snānādyadhikāro durnirvāraḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt kiñcid aṅga hānena api naimittika adhikārāt andha ādīnām meghacchanne vā darśana rūpa aṅga lope pi snāna ādi adhikāraḥ durnirvāraḥ
translated: Therefore, even with the omission of some parts, the right to the occasional rites of the blind etc. is unavoidable, even with the omission of the part in the form of seeing, when the sky is covered with clouds.

original: ata eva na naimittikānurodhena nimittasaṅkocaḥ nimittaśrutivyāghātāt /
analyzed: atas eva na naimittika anurodhena nimitta saṅkocaḥ nimitta śruti vyāghātāt
translated: For this very reason, there should not be a restriction of the occasion in accordance with the occasional rite, because that would be contrary to the Vedic text speaking of the occasion.

analyzed: yasya ubhau agnī a pāḥ adhi
translated: But in the case of whose two fires are below,

original: ityatra tu agnyanugamanamātrasya nimittatve ubhayāgniniṣpādakatayā kḷptasyāgnyādheyasyaikaikāgnijananasāmarthyābhāvena🔽pradhānasyaiva vidhyayogādākhyātāsamānādhikaraṇasubantasya ca vyavahitaparāmarśakatvena
analyzed: iti atra tu agni anugamana mātrasya nimitta tve ubhaya agni niṣpādaka tayā kḷptasya agnyādheyasya ekaika agni janana sāmarthya abhāvena  pradhānasya eva vidhi ayogāt ākhyāta asamāna adhikaraṇa sup antasya ca vyavahita parāmarśaka tvena
translated: if the mere following of the fire were the cause, then the fire-laying, which is established as producing both fires, would lack the ability to generate each individual fire,🔽and since the primary [action] cannot be connected with the injunction, and since the word ending in the verb is not in the same case as the verb,

analyzed: prakaraṇa antara abhāvena karma bheda abhāvāt agatyā nimitta saṅkocaḥ
translated: and since there is no other context, there is no difference in the action. Therefore, by default, there is restriction of the cause.

original: na ceha pradhānabhūtasnānādināndhādervirodho yena tadatiriktaviṣayatā kalpyeta /
analyzed: na ca iha pradhāna bhūta snāna ādinā andha ādeḥ virodhaḥ yena tad atirikta viṣaya tā kalpyeta
translated: And here there is no contradiction between the primary bathing etc. and the blind etc., by which its being about something other than that could be imagined.

analyzed: na ca evam andha ādeḥ api ādhāna adhikāraḥ syāt iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that in that case the blind etc. would also be entitled to the fire-laying.

analyzed: tasya svarūpataḥ nitya tva abhāvāt tathātve vā iṣṭa āpatteḥ
translated: Because that [blindness etc.] does not exist in its own form eternally, otherwise there would be an undesirable consequence.

analyzed: vyutpāditam ca etat bhaṭṭa someśbareṇa
translated: And this has been explained by Bhatta Somadeva.

analyzed: kiñca prati pradhāna nyāyena snāna śrāddha ādi artham darśana āvṛtti prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And moreover, there would be the undesirable consequence of the repetition of the Darsha-sacrifice for the purpose of bathing, Sraddha etc., according to the principle of each primary [action].

analyzed: uparāga mahākāla aikye dvi aha kāla āmnāta sākamedha avayavānām anīkavatī ādīnām prātar ādi kāleṣu
translated: Even in the unity of the Upra-sacrifice and Maha-kala, the parts of the Saakamedha sacrifice mentioned as lasting for two days, such as the Anikevata etc., in the times of morning etc.,

analyzed: sa aṅga prayoga vidhi vat grasyamāne bhavet snānam ityādi kāla bheda bhinna snāna ādi prayoga vidhi parigṛhīta tvāt
translated: Because it is included in the performance of bathing etc., which are distinguished by different times such as when being eaten along with the method of application of the limbs.

analyzed: na ca ādhāna yūpa nyāyena tantra tā
translated: And it is not a subsidiary by the principle of the sacrificial post of the fire installation.

original: vasante brāhmaṇo 'gnīnādadhīta dīkṣāsu yūpaṃ chinattiitivat a / pā / adhi /
analyzed: vasante brāhmaṇaḥ gnīn ādadhīta dīkṣāsu yūpam chinatti itivat a pā adhi
translated: Like A Brahmin should install the fires in spring, he cuts the sacrificial post during the consecration rites.

analyzed: svatantra kāla an āmnānāt
translated: Because the independent time is mentioned.

original: na ca yūpāhutivattantraṃ a / pā / adhi /
analyzed: na ca yūpa āhuti vat tantram
translated: And it is not a subsidiary like the oblation to the sacrificial post.

original: yūpasyāntike 'gniṃ mathitvā yūpāhutiṃ juhotiityatra yūpaikādaśinyāmantikadeśaikyena tathā /
analyzed: yūpasya antike gnim mathitvā yūpa āhutim juhoti iti atra yūpa aikādaśinyām antika deśa aikyena tathā
translated: In the text Having churned the fire near the sacrificial post, he offers the oblation to the sacrificial post, there it is so by the unity of the near place in the Ekādaśin sacrifice with the sacrificial post.

analyzed: iha tu pradhāna deśa bhedāt vaiṣamyam
translated: But here there is inequality due to the difference in the place of the primary rite.

analyzed: na ca svaru nyāyaḥ
translated: And it is not the principle of the Svaru.

original: a / pā / adhi tatra yūpasya tantratvena tadanuniṣpādiprathamaśakalasyaikatvāt tadrūpatvāt svarostantratā yuktā /
analyzed: a pā adhi  tatra yūpasya tantra tvena tad anu niṣpādi prathama śakalasya ekatvāt tad rūpa tvāt svaroḥ tantra tā yuktā
translated: In that case, it is proper that the Svaru is a subsidiary by the unity of the first chip which is produced in accordance with the sacrificial post, because it has that form.

analyzed: iha tu na tathā hetu abhāvāt
translated: But here it is not so, because there is no reason.

analyzed: tasmāt āvṛttiḥ duṣpariharā
translated: Therefore, repetition is difficult to avoid.

original: na ca darśanasya snānamātrāṅgatvācchrāddhādau ca taduttarakālatvasya snānottaratvenārthasiddhatvādanāvṛttiriti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca darśanasya snāna mātra aṅgatvāt śrāddha ādau ca tad uttara kāla tvasya snāna uttara tvena artha siddha tvāt anāvṛttiḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that there is no repetition because of the non-repetition of the bath, since the time after the bath is accomplished by the meaning of the bath being only an auxiliary to the Darsha-Purnamāsa sacrifice, and because the time after the bath is accomplished by the meaning of the bath being only an auxiliary to the Śrāddha etc.

analyzed: snānam dānam tapaḥ śrāddham anantam rāhu darśane
translated: Bathing, charity, penance, and śrāddha are endless when the eclipse is seen.

analyzed: iti śrāddha ādi aṅga tva avagamāt
translated: Thus, because it is understood to be a part of śrāddha etc.

original: nanu darśanasya nimittaniścayatvenādhikārasampādanopayogitayāṅgatvāt sakṛddarśane 'pi tanniścayasya jātatvādanāvṛttiriticet / na / /
analyzed: nanu darśanasya nimitta niścaya tvena adhikāra sampādana upayogi tayā aṅga tvāt sakṛt darśane tad niścayasya jāta tvāt anāvṛttiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that since the seeing is a part by being useful for accomplishing the eligibility through being the ascertainment of the occasion, even when seen once, since the ascertainment of that has arisen, there is no repetition, it is not so.

analyzed: anuṣṭhāna kālīnasya nimitta niscayasya apokṣita tvāt anuṣṭheya artha smaraṇa vat
translated: Because the ascertainment of the occasion at the time of performance is excluded, like the recollection of the object to be performed.

analyzed: anyathā madhyāhna kālīna jīvanavataḥ pi agnihotra adhikāra āpatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, because of the ascertainment of life limited by midday, there would be eligibility for the agnihotra.

original: atha tatra sāyaṅkālāvacchinnajīvananiścayavato 'dhikārastadā prakṛte 'pi grasyamānādikālāvacchinnoparāgadarśanavataḥ snānādāvadhikāra iti tulyaḥ
analyzed: atha tatra sāyaṅkāla avacchinna jīvana niścayavataḥ dhikāraḥ tadā prakṛte grasyamāna ādi kāla avacchinna uparāga darśanavataḥ snāna ādau adhikāraḥ iti tulyaḥ
translated: If it is argued that there is eligibility for one who has the ascertainment of life limited by evening time, then in the present case also there is eligibility for bathing etc. for one who has the ascertainment of the eclipse seen at the time of being swallowed etc. It is the same.

original: kiñca sphayasya bhaktāśleṣanimittejyāyāṃ pūrvakartavyāvāhana iva jyotiḥśāstrādinā
analyzed: kiñca sphayasya bhakta āśleṣa nimitta ijyāyām pūrva kartavya āvāhane iva jyotiḥśāstra ādinā
translated: Moreover, like the invocation to be performed first in the worship for the sake of the union of the devotee with the deity, by the science of astrology etc.,

analyzed: prayatna anapaneya pratibandhaka rāhitya rūpa yogyatāyāḥ aniścayāt tad viśiṣṭa darśana niścaya abhāvāt uparāga pūrva kāla kartavya mahā dāna aṅga bhūta adhivāsana ādau
translated: Because of the uncertainty of the fitness in the form of the absence of an obstruction that cannot be removed by effort, and because of the absence of the certainty of the perception qualified by that, in the consecration that is to be done before the great gift, which is an auxiliary part,

original: trirātropavāsādau ca niṣkampaṃ na ko 'pi pravartteta /🔽kiñca darśanasya nimittatve uparāge snāyādityādau uparāgādipade darśanalakṣaṇāprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tri rātra upavāsa ādau ca niṣkampam na kaḥ pi pravartteta  kiñca darśanasya nimitta tve uparāge snāyāt ityādau uparāga ādi pade darśana lakṣaṇa aprasaṅgaḥ
translated: No one would engage in the consecration that is to be done before the great gift, which is a part of it, or in the three-night fast, etc., without hesitation, due to the uncertainty of the fitness in the form of the absence of an obstruction that cannot be removed by effort, and due to the absence of the certainty of the perception qualified by that.🔽Moreover, if perception were the cause, in statements like One should bathe at an eclipse, the word eclipse would have to denote perception.

original: uparāgasya nimittatve darśane 'pi sā tulyaiveticet / satyam /
analyzed: uparāgasya nimitta tve darśane sā tulyā evā iti ced satyam
translated: If it is argued that in the case of eclipse being the cause, it is equally so in perception also, that is true.🔽In sentences connected with the locative case, such as One should bathe at the sight of Rahu,

original: rāhudarśane snāyāditi saptamīyuktavākyeṣuyasya ca bhāvena bhāvalakṣaṇam / /
analyzed: rāhu darśane snāyāt iti saptamī yukta vākyeṣu yasya ca bhāvena bhāva lakṣaṇam
translated: the locative case is prescribed by the rule The locative case is used to denote the state of something by which something is characterized,

analyzed: iti bhāva lakṣaṇa vihita saptamyā goṣu duhyamānāsu gata
translated: just as in the sentence The milking is done while the cows are going, the milking denotes the time of going.

analyzed: iti atra dohanasya gamana kāla lakṣaka tva vat dṛśeḥ kāla lakṣaṇa arthatva avaśyambhāvāt tad kāle
translated: Similarly, since it is necessary for perception to denote time,

original: ca snānādeḥ kartumaśakyatvātsakṛtpravṛttāyāitinyāyena yogyatālakṣaṇāyā api tatraiva ucitatvāt /
analyzed: ca snāna ādeḥ kartum aśakya tvāt sakṛt pravṛttāyāḥ iti nyāyena yogyatā lakṣaṇāyāḥ api tatra eva ucita tvāt
translated: and since bathing, etc. cannot be done at that time, and since even the figurative sense of fitness is appropriate there itself according to the principle of once engaged,

original: yasya gorbhāvena dohanakriyārūpadhātvarthena bhāvasya gamanasya lakṣaṇamupalakṣaṇaṃ gamanaparicchedakālādipratipādanaṃ tatra saptamī syāditi
analyzed: yasya goḥ bhāvena dohana kriyā rūpa dhātvarthena bhāvasya gamanasya lakṣaṇam upalakṣaṇam gamana pariccheda kāla ādi pratipādanam tatra saptamī syāt iti

analyzed: malimluce tu samprāpte brāhmaṇaḥ bhriyate yadi
translated: But when a Malimluca [Adhimasu] arrives, if a Brahmin dies,

analyzed: yasmin rāśi gate bhānau vipattiḥ syāt dvijanmanaḥ
translated: In which sign the Sun is, if there is misfortune for a Brahmin,

analyzed: tasmin eva prakurvīta piṇḍa dāna udaka kriyāḥ
translated: in that very [sign] one should perform the offerings of balls of rice and water.

analyzed: adhimāse vipannānām sauram mānam samāśrayet
translated: For those who have died in an intercalary month, one should rely on the solar reckoning.

analyzed: saḥ eva divasaḥ tasya śrāddha piṇḍa udaka ādiṣu
translated: That very day is for the Śrāddha, balls of rice, water, etc.

analyzed: iti vyāsa vacanena eka vākya tvāt ca
translated: And because it is syntactically connected with the statement of Vyāsa.

original: na cedaṃ vacanaṃ malamāsamṛtasya saureṇaiva māsena sarvadā pratyābdikakartavyatāparamiti samayaprakāśakṛdvyākhyānaṃ yuktam /
analyzed: na ca idam vacanam mala māsa mṛtasya saureṇa eva māsena sarvadā pratyābdika kartavya tā param iti samayaprakāśa kṛt vyākhyānam yuktam
translated: And this statement does not mean that for one who dies in an intercalary month, the annual duty should always be performed only with the solar month, as explained by the commentator of the Samāyaprakāśa.

analyzed: mala māsa mṛtasya abda antare kadācid mṛtāha aprāptau śrāddha lopa āpatteḥ

translated: Therefore, the better explanation and the one accepted by many is that for one who dies in an intercalary month, the annual [rite] should be performed again in that very intercalary month, not in the pure [month].

original: śuddhamāsamṛtānāṃ tu dvitīyādyābdikaṃ śuddha eva kāryaṃ prathamābdikaṃ tu mala eva /
analyzed: śuddha māsa mṛtānām tu dvitīya ādi ābdikam śuddhe eva kāryam prathama ābdikam tu male eva
translated: But for the pure and the immortal, the second and subsequent annual rites should be performed only on pure days, but the first annual rite should be performed only on impure days.

analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And thus

analyzed: hārītaḥ
translated: Harita:

analyzed: asaṅkrānte kartavyam ābdikam prathamam dvijaiḥ
translated: The first annual rite should be performed by Brahmins even on an asankranti day.

analyzed: tathā eva māsikam śrāddham sapiṇḍīkaraṇam tathā

analyzed: asaṅkrānte ravau malamāse iti arthaḥ

analyzed: yamaḥ pi

analyzed: trayodaśe tu samprāpte kurvīta punar ābdikam

analyzed: asya arthaḥ

analyzed: prathama ābdikam male eva syāt

translated: The meaning is that if the thirteenth year falls on an impure month, the annual rite should be performed again on the pure thirteenth year.

analyzed: laghuhārītaḥ pi
translated: The Lighu Harita also:

original: pratyabdaṃ dvādaśe māsi kāryā piṇḍakriyā sutaiḥ /

analyzed: kvacid trayodaśe syāt ādyam muktvā tu vatsaram

analyzed: pratyabdam dvādaśe māsi iti utsargaḥ mala māsa abhāve

original: kvacid dvitīyābdikādau nalamāsapāte trayodaśe śuddhe kāryam /

original: iyaṃ ca malamāsapāte dvādaśe māsi kartavyatā na saṃvatsaramadhye malamāsapāte /🔽tathāca sati dvādaśe māsi mṛtatithyalābhena sapiṇḍanānupapatteḥ /🔽kārttikamṛtasyāśvine pratyābdikaprasaṅgāt /

translated: And this performance in the twelfth month when the intercalary month occurs is not when the intercalary month occurs in the middle of the year.🔽Because in that case, due to the unavailability of the death date in the twelfth month, the Sapindikarana would be impossible.🔽Because the death in Kartika would lead to the annual ceremony in Asvina.

analyzed: kintu antimasya eva mala māsa tve ādya ābdikasya tatra karttabya tā

analyzed: tat ayam arthaḥ

analyzed: evam ca

analyzed: śrāddhīya ahani samprāpte adhimāsaḥ bhavet yadi

analyzed: iti vaśiṣṭha vacanam māsika viṣayam vyākhyeyam  yāni tat kāryam vyāghrasya vacanam yathā

analyzed: hārītaḥ

analyzed: tathā eva kāmyam yat karma vatsarāt prathamāt ṛte

analyzed: sapiṇḍīkaraṇāt ūrdhvam yat kiñcid śrāddhikam bhavet
translated: After the Sapindikarana, whatever Shraddha rite there may be,

analyzed: iti asya arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning of this.

analyzed: tulā makara meṣa siṃheṣu eva yuga ādayaḥ iti pratīteḥ
translated: And it is well known that the equinoxes etc. are only in Libra, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Leo.

original: yaccajyeṣṭhemāsi site pakṣeityādivacaneṣu daśaharādau cāndramāsavācijyeṣṭhādipadaśravaṇaṃ tadagatyā lakṣaṇayā sauramāsaparam /

translated: And the mention of the words Jyeṣṭha etc. denoting the lunar month in the statements beginning with in the bright fortnight of the month of Jyeṣṭha and on the ten lunar days of the equinoxes etc. is figuratively referring to the solar month out of necessity.

analyzed: chandogāḥ militāḥ kuryuḥ utsargam sarva chandasām

translated: Because it is possible to interpret the word Śrāvaṇa as referring to the well-known solar month, and the word from Vṛṣa etc. as referring to the Chandogas who depend on the well-known solar month, and there is no evidence for the figurative use of the word Śrāvaṇa. Therefore,

analyzed: sāmaga anyaiḥ upākarma utsarjane male na kārye

analyzed: atas eva
translated: For this very reason,

translated: there would be postponement of the rites like Upākarma due to the delay in the season.

analyzed: abhiṣeka ādi vṛddhīnām na tu utkarṣaḥ yuga ādiṣu
translated: But there is no postponement of the rites like Abhiṣeka due to the delay in the Yugas.

analyzed: tasmāt uktā eva vyavasthā āśrayaṇīyā

analyzed: yat tu smṛtisaṅgrahe
translated: But in Smṛti Saṅgraha,

original: iti nāgarakhaṇḍavacanenāṣāḍhītaḥ saptame pakṣe vihitatvāt malamāse niṣedhaḥ spaṣṭa eva /
analyzed: iti nāgarakhaṇḍa vacanena āṣāḍhītaḥ saptame pakṣe vihita tvāt malamāse niṣedhaḥ spaṣṭaḥ eva
translated: Since it is enjoined in the seventh fortnight from Āṣāḍha by this statement from the Nāgarakhaṇḍa, the prohibition in the intercalary month is clear.🔽But even when there is an intercalary month of Āśvina, then also the Mahālaya should not be performed in the defiled Āśvina due to the confusion of connection with Virgo, but rather in the dark fortnight of Bhādrapada itself, because it is stated that

original: yadā tvāśvinasyādhimāsatvaṃ tadāpi na kanyāsambandhabhrāntyā malināśvine mahālayaḥ kāryaḥ kintu bhādrāparapakṣa evaanyatrava tu pañcamaḥityabhidhānāt🔽na ca kanyāyogābhāve kathaṃ tatra śrāddhamiti vācyam /
analyzed: yadā tu āśvinasya adhimāsa tvam tadā api na kanyā sambandha bhrāntyā malināśvine mahālayaḥ kāryaḥ kintu bhādra aparapakṣe eva tu pañcamaḥ iti abhidhānāt  na ca kanyā yoga abhāve katham tatra śrāddham iti vācyam
translated: it should be the fifth in other cases.🔽And it should not be said how the Śrāddha is performed there in the absence of the conjunction with Virgo.

original: sakalasya pakṣasya kanyāyogābhāve kathaṃ tatra śrāddhamiti vācyam /
analyzed: sakalasya pakṣasya kanyā yoga abhāve katham tatra śrāddham iti vācyam
translated: It should be said how the Śrāddha is performed there in the absence of the conjunction with Virgo of the entire fortnight.

original: sakalasya pakṣasya kanyāsambandhābhāve 'pi bhādrapadakṛṣṇapakṣasya kanyāsaṅkrāntisparśavattvena tatra śrāddhasyānuṣṭhānaṃ śakyatvāt /
analyzed: sakalasya pakṣasya kanyā sambandha abhāve bhādrapada kṛṣṇapakṣasya kanyā saṅkrānti sparśavat tvena tatra śrāddhasya anuṣṭhānam śakya tvāt
translated: Even in the absence of the entire lunar fortnight's connection with Virgo, since the dark fortnight of Bhadrapada is capable of being touched by the transit of the sun into Virgo, the performance of Śrāddha in that [fortnight] is possible.

analyzed: atas eva
translated: For this very reason,

original: ante vā yadi vā madhye yatra kanyāṃ ravirvrajet /
analyzed: ante vā yadi vā madhye yatra kanyām raviḥ vrajet
translated: whether at the end or in the middle, wherever the sun enters Virgo,

original: sa pakṣaḥ sakalaḥ pūjyaḥ śrāddhaṃ tatra vidhīyate //
analyzed: sa pakṣaḥ sakalaḥ pūjyaḥ śrāddham tatra vidhīyate
translated: that entire fortnight is to be worshipped, and Śrāddha is performed in that [fortnight].

original: iti kārṣṇājinivacane 'pi sakalasya pakṣasya kanyāyogābhāve 'pi tatra śrāddhamuktam /
analyzed: iti sakalasya pakṣasya kanyā yoga abhāve tatra śrāddham uktam
translated: Even in the absence of the entire fortnight's connection with Virgo, Śrāddha is mentioned in this statement of Kṛṣṇājiṇa.

original: śūlapāṇyādimate tu kanyāsambandhanirapekṣasya pañcamapakṣasyaiva śrāddhakālatvādyuktameva tatra śrāddhānuṣṭhānam /
analyzed: śūlapāṇi ādi mate tu kanyā sambandha nirapekṣasya pañcamapakṣasya eva śrāddha kāla tvāt yuktam eva tatra śrāddha anuṣṭhānam
translated: But in the opinion of Śūlapāṇi and others, since only the fifth fortnight, which is independent of the connection with Virgo, is the time for Śrāddha, the performance of Śrāddha in that [fifth fortnight] is indeed proper.

original: yattu tanmate kanyāgatāparapakṣe sakṛtkriyamāṇaśrāddhāntara tat kanyāgatāparapakṣasya
analyzed: yat tu tad mate kanyā gata aparapakṣe tat kanyā gata aparapakṣasya
translated: But in that opinion, the other Śrāddha performed once in the latter fortnight of Virgo, that [other Śrāddha]

analyzed: pañcama tva asambhavāt malina āśvine prāptam api vakṣyamāṇa vacana anusārāt tulā gata aparapakṣe eva kāryam
translated: since the latter fortnight of Virgo cannot be the fifth [fortnight], is obtained in the dark fortnight of Aśvina, but should be performed only in the latter fortnight of Libra in accordance with the statement to be mentioned later.

original: vastutastu kanyāgatāparapakṣaśrāddhaṃ na pañcamapakṣaśrāddhādbhinnaṃ śrāddhabhede vidhikalpanāgauravāpatteḥ /
analyzed: vastutas tu kanyā gata aparapakṣa śrāddham na pañcamapakṣa śrāddhāt bhinnam śrāddha bhede vidhi kalpanā gaurava āpatteḥ
translated: But in reality, the śrāddha on the new moon day of the dark fortnight is not different from the śrāddha on the fifth fortnight, because if it were a different śrāddha, it would lead to the fault of having to assume a separate injunction.

original: pañcamapakṣasyaante vā yadi vā madhyaiti vacanena kanyopalakṣitasyaiva śrāddhakālatvapratīteśca /🔽na ca kanyāsambandhābhāve pañcamapakṣe
analyzed: pañcama pakṣasya ante vā yadi vā madhya eti vacanena kanyā upalakṣitasya eva śrāddha kāla tva pratīteḥ ca  na ca kanyā sambandha abhāve pañcama pakṣe
translated: And because it is understood from the statement at the end of the fifth fortnight or in the middle that the time for śrāddha is indicated by the new moon itself.

analyzed: śrāddha karaṇa āpattiḥ
translated: And if there is no connection with the new moon, there is no fault in performing the śrāddha on the fifth fortnight.

analyzed: tasmin kanyā sambandhasya āvaśyaka tvāt
translated: Because in that case, the connection with the new moon is necessary.

original: śrāvaṇabhādrayorhi malamāsatve pañcamapakṣasya kanyāsambandho na bhavet /
analyzed: śrāvaṇa bhādrayoḥ hi mala māsa tve pañcama pakṣasya kanyā sambandhaḥ na bhavet
translated: For if Śrāvaṇa and Bhādrapada are intercalary months, the fifth fortnight would not be connected with the new moon.

original: tadā ca saptamapakṣasya vihitatvāt kanyopalakṣita eva śrāddhaprāptiriti na kāpi kṣatiḥ /
analyzed: tadā ca saptama pakṣasya vihita tvāt kanyā upalakṣitaḥ eva śrāddha prāptiḥ iti na kā api kṣatiḥ
translated: And then, since the seventh fortnight is prescribed, the śrāddha is obtained only when indicated by the new moon. So there is no harm at all.

original: yadā tu āśvinasya malinatvaṃ tadāpi pañcamapakṣasya kanyāsambandho 'styeva amāyāmeva kanyāpraveśāt tena ekameva śrāddhamiti yuktaṃ bahusammataṃ 🔽ca /
analyzed: yadā tu āśvinasya malina tvam tadā api pañcama pakṣasya kanyā sambandhaḥ u sti eva amāyām eva kanyā praveśāt tena ekam eva śrāddham iti yuktam bahu sammatam 🔽ca
translated: But even when Āśvina is intercalary, the fifth fortnight is indeed connected with the new moon, because the new moon enters only on the new moon day. Therefore, it is proper that there should be only one śrāddha, which is accepted by many.

original: tadapi cāśvinasya malinatve 'pi kanyopalakṣitasya mukhyasyaiva pañcamapakṣasya lābhāttatraiva kāryam /🔽yattu
analyzed: tat api ca āśvinasya malina tve pi kanyā upalakṣitasya mukhyasya eva pañcamapakṣasya lābhāt tatra eva kāryam  yat tu
translated: And that (rite) should be performed there (in the bright half of Āśvina) itself, even if Āśvina is inauspicious, because the principal fifth lunar day characterized by the presence of a virgin (i.e., the new moon) is obtained (in that month).🔽But (there is) this (statement) of the grandfather of the Jyotisha (science):

analyzed: māsaḥ kanyā gate bhānau asahkrāntaḥ bhavet yadi
translated: If the month (of Śrāvaṇa) has the new moon when the Sun is in Virgo,

original: daivaṃ pitryaṃ tadā karma tulāsthe karturakṣayam //
analyzed: daivam pitryam tadā karma tulā sthe kartuḥ akṣayam
translated: then the rite for the gods and manes is inexhaustible when the Sun is in Libra.

original: iti jyotiḥ pitāmahavacanaṃ tulāstharavau kartavyatvabodhakaṃ tanmahālayātiriktavrīhipākādiśrāddhaparam /
analyzed: iti jyotiḥ pitāmaha vacanam tulā stha ravau kartavya tva bodhakam tat mahālaya atirikta vrīhi pāka ādi śrāddha param
translated: This statement of the grandfather of the Jyotisha (science) which indicates that it should be performed when the Sun is in Libra, refers to Śrāddha rites other than Mahālaya, such as the cooking of rice.

original: athavā mahālayasyayāvadvṛścikadarśanamiti gauṇakāle 'pi vihitatvād gauṇakālabhrāntyā malināśvine kriyamāṇasya niṣedhadvārā tulāstharavau
analyzed: athavā mahālayasya yāvat vṛścika darśanam iti gauṇa kāle pi vihita tvāt gauṇa kāla bhrāntyā malina āśvine kriyamāṇasya niṣedha dvārā tulā stha ravau
translated: Or, since (the performance of) Mahālaya is enjoined even during the secondary period (of the year) beginning with the appearance of Scorpio up to the appearance of Virgo, (this statement) prohibits (the performance of) Mahālaya (Śrāddha) which is performed during the inauspicious Āśvina under the delusion that it is the secondary period (of the year), and (enjoins it) during the period when the Sun is in Libra.

analyzed: yat tu kāla ādarśena
translated: But (there is) this (statement) of the Kāla-darśa:

analyzed: ā abda uda kumbha manu ādi mahālaya yuga ādiṣu
translated: In the years beginning with the year of the water-pot, in the pairs of Mahālaya (Śrāddha) beginning with the year of the new moon,

original: iti kartavyeṣu mahālayaparigaṇanaṃ kṛtaṃ tat mahālayākhyatīrthaparam /
analyzed: iti kartavyeṣu mahālaya parigaṇanam kṛtam tat mahālaya ākhya tīrtha param
translated: (and) this enumeration of Mahālaya (Śrāddha) which is made among the (Śrāddha rites) to be performed, refers to the holy place called Mahālaya.

analyzed: mādhava sammataḥ api ayam arthaḥ
translated: This meaning is also approved by Mādhava.

original: atra ca jyotiḥ pitāmahavākye daivasyāpi kanyākartavyasya tulāyāṃ kartavyatvapratīterdurgāsthāpanādikamapi tatraiva kāryam /

translated: And here, in the statement of the grandfather Jyotiṣa, since it is understood that even the divine rite to be performed for a daughter should be performed in the balance, the installation of Durgā and so on should also be done there itself.

analyzed: iti pariśiṣṭa vacanāt ca

analyzed: varddhamānām amāvāsyām labhet ced apare hani

analyzed: iti pariśiṣṭa vacanāt

analyzed: candra darśana adarśana kṛtaḥ tayoḥ apavādaḥ tu pūrvam eva uktaḥ
translated: The exception to those two caused by the seeing or not seeing of the moon has already been stated before.

analyzed: ayam ca tritaya ajñāne pūrva kāla antara vidhiḥ gauravāt
