translated: And therefore, since it is understood that the śrāddha on the death anniversary should be performed when there is merely an obstacle, it follows that it should be performed even when there is an obstacle due to impurity.

original: na caikādaśyādikālapuraskāreṇātra deyatvāvagamānna ṛṣyaśṛṅgavacanenāśau cāntakālavidhisambhava itivācyam /
analyzed: na ca ekādaśī ādi kāla puraskāreṇa atra deya tva avagamāt na ṛṣyaśṛṅga vacanena āśau ca antakāla vidhi sambhavaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that since it is understood here that it should be performed by postponing the time of the eleventh day etc., it is not possible to enjoin the time at the end of impurity by the words of Ṛṣyaśṛṅga.

original: asya satyapi deyatāviśeṣaparatve ārthikasya deyatāsāmānyasyopajīvanenātra kālāntaravidhiḥ sambhavatyeva /
analyzed: asya sati api deyatā viśeṣa paratve ārthikasya deyatā sāmānyasya upajīvanena atra kāla antara vidhiḥ sambhavati eva
translated: Even though this (verse) has the purpose of enjoining the particularity of the performance, the general rule of performance, which is implied, is followed, and therefore the injunction of a different time here is certainly possible.

analyzed: yathā sati api āgneyyāḥ stotra ādi viśeṣa sambandhe rtha siddham kratu sāmānya sambandham lāghavāt upajīvya āgneyyā āgnīdhram upatiṣṭhate iti atra āgnidhra upasthāna aṅgatvena  vidhiḥ
translated: Just as, even though the Āgneya has a connection with the specific Stotra etc., the general connection with the sacrifice is established by the meaning, and the Āgneya worships the Agnīdhra as an auxiliary to the worship of the Agnīdhra, based on the simpler connection.🔽Here the injunction is as an auxiliary to the worship of the Agnīdhra.

original: evaṃ ca atratyasya ekādaśyādikālasyana tvanyā vai kadācanaiti ṛṣyaśṛṅgavacanena niṣedhānmṛtāhapratyāsannamukhyāśaucānantaradināpekṣayā gauṇatvam
analyzed: evam ca atratyasya ekādaśī ādi kālasya na tu anyā vai kadācana eti ṛṣyaśṛṅga vacanena niṣedhāt mṛtāha pratyāsanna mukhya āśauca anantara dina apekṣayā gauṇa tvam
translated: And thus, the time of the Ekādaśī etc. here is secondary in relation to the day immediately following the primary impurity that is near the death anniversary, because it is prohibited by the statement of Ṛṣyaśṛṅga, Never on any other day.

original: niṣedhārthamupajīvyasya tasya sarvathā pratiṣeddhumaśakyatvena pratiṣedhasya sambhavadviṣayatvāt /
analyzed: niṣedha artham upajīvyasya tasya sarvathā pratiṣeddhum aśakya tvena pratiṣedhasya sambhavat viṣaya tvāt
translated: Because the prohibition is possible only when the object of the prohibition is capable of being prohibited, since it is impossible to completely prohibit that which is the basis of the prohibition.

analyzed: atas eva smṛti candrikā kālādarśa hemādri pramukhaiḥ laghu hārīta vacanam āśauca vighne vyākhyāya āśauca anta kāla apekṣayā ekādaśī ādi kālasya gauṇa tvam uktam
translated: For this very reason, Smṛti-candra, Kāla-darśa, Hemādri, and others have explained the statement of Laghu-Hārīta as referring to the time of the Ekādaśī etc. as secondary in relation to the time at the end of impurity, even in the case of an obstruction to impurity.

original: etena yatkenaciduktamāśaucavighne āśaucāntatithau deyaṃ na kṛṣṇaikādaśī pratīkṣaṇīyā tasyāna tvanyā vai kadācanaityanena pratiṣedhāt vignāntaraviṣayatvamiti
analyzed: etena yat kenacid uktam āśauca vighne āśauca anta tithau deyam na kṛṣṇa ekādaśī pratīkṣaṇīyā tu anyā vai kadācana eti anena pratiṣedhāt vigna antara viṣaya tvam iti
translated: By this (verse), what was said by someone that when there is an obstacle to impurity, the Śrāddha should be performed on the day of the end of impurity, and the Kṛṣṇa Ekādaśī should not be awaited, because it is prohibited by the text not on any other day, and therefore it refers to a different obstacle,

analyzed: yat ca gauḍa ekadeśinā uktam
translated: and what was said by a resident of a part of Gauḍa,

analyzed: śrāddha vighne samutpanne tu antarā mṛta sūtake
translated: When an obstacle to Śrāddha arises in between, in the case of a death or birth pollution,

original: ekādaśyāṃ na karttvayaṃ darśe vāpi vicakṣaṇaiḥ //
analyzed: ekādaśyām na karttu ayam darśe vā api vicakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: it should not be performed on the Ekādaśī or even on the new moon day by the wise.

analyzed: iti bahu nibandha dhṛta vacanāt āśauca ante eva kāryam iti
translated: and that therefore it should be performed only at the end of impurity, based on the statement found in many treatises,

analyzed: tat api apāstam vā uditabyam
translated: that too should be refuted.

analyzed: udāhṛta vacanam tu sambhavat viṣayam vyākhyeyam
translated: But the quoted statement should be explained as referring to a possible case.

analyzed: anyathā
translated: Otherwise,

analyzed: prāpte pratyābdike śrāddhe tu antarā mūta sūtake
translated: When the annual Śrāddha has arrived, and there is a death or birth pollution in between,

analyzed: āśauca anantaram kuryāt tat māsa indu kṣaye vā
translated: it should be performed after the impurity, or even on the new moon day of that month.

analyzed: iti kāla ādarśa dhṛta gobhila vacanasya nirviṣaya tva āpatteḥ  tasmāt āśaucena śrāddha pratibandhe āśauca ante kāryam
translated: because then the statement of Gobhila found in the Kālādarśa would become meaningless.🔽Therefore, when Śrāddha is obstructed by impurity, it should be performed at the end of impurity.

analyzed: tatra pramāda ādinā śrāddha asambhave amāvāsyāyām
translated: There, if Śrāddha is not possible due to negligence etc., it should be performed on the new moon day.

analyzed: tasyāḥ prāk udāhṛta kāla ādarśam dhṛta gobhila vacanena āśauca puraskāreṇa vihita tvāt
translated: Because it is laid down by the words of Gobhila, which are quoted in the Kalāpasūtra, by putting the impurity first.

original: tatrāpyasambhave kṛṣṇekādaśyāṃ laghuhārītavacane vighnasāmānye tasyā vihitatvāt /
analyzed: tatra api asambhave kṛṣṇa ekādaśyām laghu hārīta vacane vighna sāmānye tasyāḥ vihita tvāt
translated: And even there, if it is not possible, then on the eleventh day of the dark fortnight, because it is laid down by the words of the Lighu Hārīta, in the case of an obstacle in general.

original: tatrāpyasambhave śuklaikādaśyāṃ tasyā api viśeṣata i tyuttyānukalpatvena sūcitatvāt /
analyzed: tatra api asambhave śukla ekādaśyām tasyāḥ api viśeṣataḥ i ti uttyā anukalpa tvena sūcita tvāt
translated: And even there, if it is not possible, then on the eleventh day of the bright fortnight, because it is indicated as an alternative by the words even that (should be done) especially.

original: yattvatra vācaspatinā laghuhārītavacanasya āśaucātiriktamṛtāhapratibandhaviṣayatvamuktaṃ tatna tvanyā vai kadācanaityaprāptakālapratiṣedhānupapatterayuktam
analyzed: yat tu atra vācaspatinā laghuhārīta vacanasya āśauca atirikta mṛta aha pratibandha viṣayatvam uktam tat na tu anyā vai kadācana eti aprāpta kāla pratiṣedha anupapatteḥ ayuktam
translated: But what has been said by Vācaspati here, that the words of the Lighu Hārīta refer to the obstruction of the death-day other than impurity, that is not proper, because the prohibition of the time not arrived, she should never (marry) on any other day, is not proper.

analyzed: śūlapāṇiḥ api evam
translated: And Śūlapāṇi also (says) thus.

original: iyaṃ cāśaucavighne tadantakartavyatā puraṣaprayatnānapaneyāśaucavighne na tu puruṣaprayatnāpaneye tasya śrāddhāharvihitaśaucādevāpagamāt /
analyzed: iyam ca āśauca vighne tad anta kartavya tā puraṣa prayatna anapaneyā āśauca vighne na tu puruṣa prayatna apaneye tasya śrāddha ahar vihita śaucāt eva apagamāt
translated: And this (rule) regarding the duties to be done at the end of that (impurity) in the case of the obstruction of impurity which cannot be removed by human effort, but not in the case of the obstruction which can be removed by human effort, because it ceases by the purification etc. prescribed on the day of the Śrāddha.

original: tathā ca kṣatāśaucasyāpi puruṣaprayatnānapaneyatvāt kṣatāśaucena vighne tadanta eva kāryamititi kecit /
analyzed: tathā ca kṣata āśaucasya api puruṣa prayatna anapaneya tvāt kṣata āśaucena vighne tad ante eva kāryam iti iti kecid
translated: And thus, because the impurity caused by a wound also cannot be removed by human effort, some (say) that if there is an obstruction by the impurity caused by a wound, it should be done at the end of that (impurity caused by a wound) itself.

original: anyetu kṣatāśaucasya āśaucatve pramāṇābhāvāt āśaucitve 'pi vā
analyzed: anye tu kṣata āśaucasya āśauca tve pramāṇa abhāvāt āśauci tve vā
translated: Others say that in the case of a wound-impurity, since there is no evidence for it being an impurity, or even if it is an impurity,

analyzed: śrāddha vighne samutpanne tu antarā mṛta sūtake
translated: when an obstacle arises in a śrāddha, in the case of a miscarriage or death occurring in between,

original: itipūrvodāhṛtavacanena jananamaraṇāśauca eva tadantakartavyatāvidhānāt na kṣatāśauce tadante kāryaṃ kintu ekādaśyādāvevetyāhuḥ /
analyzed: iti pūrva udāhṛta vacanena janana maraṇa āśauce eva tad anta kartavya tā vidhānāt na kṣata āśauce tad ante kāryam kintu ekādaśī ādau eva iti āhuḥ
translated: since the performance of the rites at the end of it is prescribed only in the case of the impurities of birth and death, as stated in the above-quoted passage, nothing should be done at the end of it in the case of a wound-impurity, but rather on the eleventh day or the like.

original: evañca yanmate tadantakartavyatā tanmate pūrvadinakartavyaniyamasyāpi uttaredyurevānuṣṭhānaṃ pūrvadine nirvraṇībhāvasaṃśayena pradhānakartavyatvāniścayāt
analyzed: evam ca yad mate tad anta kartavya tā tad mate pūrva dina kartavya niyamasya api uttaredyus eva anuṣṭhānam pūrva dine nirvraṇībhāva saṃśayena pradhāna kartavya tva aniścayāt
translated: And thus, in the view that the rites are to be performed at the end of it, even the rule regarding what is to be done on the previous day is to be performed on the next day itself, because the main rite is not to be done on the previous day due to the doubt of being unfit.

analyzed: na ca uttaredyus api pūrvāhṇa rūpa kāla abhāvāt ananuṣṭhānam iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that it is not to be performed even on the next day due to the absence of the time in the form of the forenoon.

analyzed: aṅga anurodhena pradhāna lopasya anyāyya tvāt
translated: Because it is not proper for the main rite to be omitted due to the consideration of the subsidiary.

analyzed: na vā a kāle kṛtam a kṛtam iti vācyam
translated: Nor should it be said that what is done out of time is as good as not done.

analyzed: gauṇa kālasya vidyamāna tvāt
translated: Because the secondary time is present.

analyzed: anyathā sadyaskālāyām amāvāsyāyām pūrva dina sādhya anvādhāna ādi lopa āpatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, if it were not so, there would be the undesirable consequence of the omission of the rites like the vāḍavā to be performed on the previous day on the new moon day which is impossible to be performed on the same day.

original: evañca yadbācaspatinoktaṃ vraṇāśaucasthale pūrvadinakṛtyamanaṅgemeva nirvraṇībhāvasaṃśayena🔽pūrvadine pradhānakartavyatvāniścayāduttaradine ca tanniścaye pūrvāhṇarūpakālābhāvātsphyāśleṣe
analyzed: evam ca yat bācaspatinā uktam vraṇa āśauca sthale pūrva dina kṛtyam anaṅgema iva nirvraṇībhāva saṃśayena  pūrva dine pradhāna kartavya tva aniścayāt uttara dine ca tad niścaye pūrvāhṇa rūpa kāla abhāvāt sphya āśleṣe
translated: And thus what has been said by Vācaspati in the case of impurity due to a wound, that the duties of the previous day are to be performed only when there is doubt about becoming free from the wound,

analyzed: jyāyām āvāhanasya iva bādhaḥ iti
translated: because there is uncertainty about the principal duties to be performed on the previous day, and on the following day, when there is certainty about that, due to the absence of the time in the form of the forenoon, like the obstruction of the invocation in the conjunction of Śravaṇa and Aśleṣā,

analyzed: tat nirastam
translated: that is refuted.

analyzed: gauṇa kāla sattvena aṅga lopasya anyāyya tvāt
translated: Because the omission of auxiliaries is not proper due to the existence of the secondary time.

original: yadapi ca dṛṣṭāntakathanaṃ tadapi daśame āvāhanasya nimittānantaraṃ kartavyatvābhidhānāt ākarājñānamūlam /
analyzed: yat api ca dṛṣṭānta kathanam tat api daśame āvāhanasya nimitta anantaram kartavya tva abhidhānāt ākara ajñāna mūlam
translated: And the statement of an example is also based on the ignorance of the source, because in the tenth (chapter) it is stated that the invocation should be done immediately after the cause.

original: evañca jananamaraṇāśaucāntyadinottaradine śrāddhakaraṇe taddina eva pūrvadinakṛtyānuṣṭhānaṃ pūrvadine āśaucasattvena anadhikārāt /
analyzed: evam ca janana maraṇa āśauca antya dina uttara dine śrāddha karaṇe tad dine eva pūrva dina kṛtya anuṣṭhānam pūrva dine āśauca sattvena anadhikārāt
translated: And thus, when the Śrāddha is performed on the day after the last day of impurity due to birth or death, the performance of the duties of the previous day is on that very day, because there is no entitlement due to the existence of impurity on the previous day.

original: yāni tu arthaluptāni ekabhaktādīni teṣāṃ lopa eva /
analyzed: yāni tu artha luptāni eka bhakta ādīni teṣām lopaḥ eva
translated: But those that are incomplete in meaning, such as eating only one meal, their omission is proper.

original: vācaspatistu pūrvadina eva kāryaṃ tatra śaucasyātantratvāt ekādaśāhaśrāddhavadityāha /
analyzed: vācaspatiḥ tu pūrva dine eva kāryam tatra śaucasya atantra tvāt ekādaśa aha śrāddha vat iti āha
translated: But Vācaspati says that it should be done on the previous day itself, because purity is not essential there, like the Śrāddha performed on the eleventh day.

original: atra cadeye pitṝṇāṃityatra mṛtāhanirūpyaśrāddhasya tasminnahani āśauce tadantakartavyatā bodhyate /
analyzed: atra ca deye pitṝṇām iti atra mṛtāha nirūpya śrāddhasya tasmin ahani āśauce tad anta kartavya tā bodhyate
translated: And here, in the phrase to be given to the ancestors, it is understood that the Śrāddha, which is to be performed on that day, is to be done at the end of that impurity.

analyzed: atas ca māsika ūna ṣāṇmāsika traipakṣika ādīnām api lābhaḥ
translated: And thus there is the benefit of the monthly, the six-monthly, the three-fortnightly, etc. also.

original: tena māsikasāṃvatsarikayorāśaucavighne tadante kartavyatā tadasambhave tu amāvāsyādau /
analyzed: tena māsika sāṃvatsarikayoḥ āśauca vighne tad ante kartavya tā tad asambhave tu amāvāsyā ādau
translated: Therefore, if there is an obstruction to the monthly or annual (Śrāddha), it should be done at the end of it. But if that is not possible, then on the new moon day, etc.

analyzed: āśauca atirikta vighne tu māsika ekoddiṣṭam māsika antara dine kāryam
translated: But if there is an obstruction other than impurity, the monthly Ekoddiṣṭa should be performed on another day of the month.

analyzed: tathā ācā atriḥ
translated: And thus it is said three times:

analyzed: tat ahar ced praduṣyeta kena cit sūtaka ādinā
translated: If that day should be polluted by some impurity, etc.,

analyzed: sūtaka anantaram kuryāt punar tat ahar eva vā
translated: one should perform it after the impurity, or on that very day again.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: atra ca prathamasya kālasya sūtakavighnaviṣayatvaṃ ṛṣyaśṛṅgabacanaikavākyatvāt /
analyzed: atra ca prathamasya kālasya sūtaka vighna viṣaya tvam ṛṣyaśṛṅga bacana eka vākya tvāt
translated: And here, the first rule refers to the obstruction of impurity, because it is syntactically connected with the statement of Ṛṣyaśṛṅga.
But the second refers to obstructions other than the impurity mentioned by the word etc.

original: ṛṣyaśṛṅgavacanasya sāmānyavacanatve 'pi anayoḥ pakṣayorvikalpasya aṣṭadoṣaduṣṭatvādbhinnaviṣayatvaṃ yuktameva /
analyzed: ṛṣyaśṛṅga vacanasya sāmānya vacana tve pi anayoḥ pakṣayoḥ vikalpasya aṣṭa doṣa duṣṭa tvāt bhinna viṣaya tvam yuktam eva
translated: Even though the statement of Ṛṣyaśṛṅga is a general statement, it is proper that these two alternatives have different subjects, because they are defective due to the eight faults.

analyzed: na ca etasya māsika ekoddiṣṭa viṣaya tve māna abhāvaḥ
translated: And there is no lack of evidence for this referring to the monthly Ekoddiṣṭa.

analyzed: māsikam ca uda kumbham ca yat yat antaritam bhavet
translated: And the monthly water pot, whatever may be intervening,

analyzed: tat tat uttara sātantryāt anuṣṭheyam pracakṣate
translated: They declare that to be to be performed by the rule of the subsequent being independent.

analyzed: iti vacana eka vākya tā lābhena tathā niścayāt
translated: Thus, by the attainment of syntactical unity with the statement, it is ascertained thus.

analyzed: atas eva hemādrau devala vacanam
translated: For this very reason, in the Hemādri, there is the statement of Devala:

original: ekoddiṣṭe tu samprāpte yadi vighnaḥ grajāyate /
analyzed: ekoddiṣṭe tu samprāpte yadi vighnaḥ grajāyate
translated: But when the Ekoddiṣṭa has arrived, if an obstacle arises,

analyzed: māse tasmin śrāddham kuryāt prayatnataḥ
translated: On another month, on that Tithi, one should carefully perform the Śrāddha.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: yadyapi cātra nimittakathanabelāyāmekoddiṣṭapadaṃ māsikābdikasādhāraṇaṃ pratīyate tathāpi māse 'nyasminnitivacanānmāsikaikoddiṣṭaparameva /
analyzed: yadi api ca atra nimitta kathana belāyām ekoddiṣṭa padam māsika ābdika sādhāraṇam pratīyate tathā api māse ni asmin iti vacanāt māsika ekoddiṣṭa param eva
translated: And although here, at the time of stating the occasion, the word Ekoddiṣṭa is understood to be common to the monthly and annual (Śrāddha), still, because of the statement on another month, it refers only to the monthly Ekoddiṣṭa.

analyzed: anyathā abde nyasmin iti brūyāt
translated: Otherwise, it would say on another year.

original: idaṃ ca māsikāntaradinarūpakālavidhānaṃ na kṛṣṇaikādaśyādyasambhave tasya māsikapuraskāreṇa viśeṣavihitatvāt /
analyzed: idam ca māsika antara dina rūpa kāla vidhānam na kṛṣṇa ekādaśī ādi asambhave tasya māsika puraskāreṇa viśeṣa vihita tvāt
translated: And this injunction of the time in the form of another day of the monthly (Śrāddha) is not when the eleventh day of the dark fortnight is not possible, because that is specially enjoined by placing the monthly (Śrāddha) first.

analyzed: atas eva smṛticandrikā kāreṇa amāvāsyāyām prakurvīta eti vacanam sāṃvatsarika śrāddha viṣayam iti uktam
translated: For this very reason, the author of Smṛti-candra has said that the statement one should perform on the new moon day refers to the annual Śrāddha.

analyzed: gauḍanibandhe tu ekādaśī ādau akaraṇe māsika antara dine kāryam iti uktam
translated: But in the Gauḍa commentary, it is said that if the monthly śrāddha cannot be performed on the Ekādaśī day, it should be performed on another day of the month.

original: atra coktavacane ekoddiṣṭagrahaṇādekoddiṣṭarūpeṣveva māsikeṣu dināntarakālavidhānaṃ na pārvaṇarūpeṣu anumāsikeṣviti candrikākāraḥ /
analyzed: atra ca ukta vacane ekoddiṣṭa grahaṇāt ekoddiṣṭa rūpeṣu eva māsikeṣu dina antara kāla vidhānam na pārvaṇa rūpeṣu anumāsikeṣu iti candrikākāraḥ
translated: And here, the author of the Candrikā says that according to the statement made, the injunction of another day is only in the monthly śrāddhas of the Ekoddiṣṭa form, and not in the Pārvaṇa-type monthly śrāddhas.

original: atra ca patitamāsikaṃ kṛtvā paścāttaddinamāsikaṃ kāryaṃ kḷptakramatyāge pramāṇābhāvāt iti gauḍāḥ /
analyzed: atra ca patita māsikam kṛtvā paścāt tat dina māsikam kāryam kḷpta krama tyāge pramāṇa abhāvāt iti gauḍāḥ
translated: And here, the Gauḍas say that after performing the monthly śrāddha for the deceased, the monthly śrāddha for that day should be performed later, because there is no authority for abandoning the established order.

analyzed: tatra eka kāla karttṛka tvena tantrasya eva yukta tvāt
translated: Because it is proper for the Tantra itself to be performed on the same day by the same performer.

analyzed: śrāddha kramasya ārthika tvena tad vādhe pi a vaiguṇyāt
translated: And because the order of the śrāddha is meaningful, there is no defect even if it is violated.

original: astu vā kramasyāṅgatvaṃ tathāpi anupādeyakālānurodhena tadbādho yukta eva /
analyzed: astu vā kramasya aṅga tvam tathā api anupādeya kāla anurodhena tad bādhaḥ yuktaḥ eva
translated: Or let the order be a subsidiary, even then the violation of it is proper in accordance with the time that is not to be adopted.

original: na ca aparāṅṇādeḥ atiśayamātrārthatvāttadbādhe 'pi na śrāddhakālabādha iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca aparāṅṇa ādeḥ atiśaya mātra ārthatvāt tad bādhe na śrāddha kāla bādhaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that even if the time for śrāddha is violated, there is no violation of the time for śrāddha, because the Aparāhṇa and other times are only for the sake of excellence.

analyzed: tādṛśa apara aṅṇa ādi anurodhena api tantrasya yukta tvāt
translated: Because even in accordance with such Aparāhṇa and other times, the Tantra is proper.

original: anyathā kālabādhābhāve bhinnaprayogavacanaparigṛhītatvāt saṅkāntyamāvāsyādiśrāddhānāmapi bhedena karaṇāpattiḥ /
analyzed: anyathā kāla bādhā abhāve bhinna prayoga vacana parigṛhīta tvāt saṅkānti amāvāsyā ādi śrāddhānām api bhedena karaṇa āpattiḥ
translated: Otherwise, if there were no obstruction by time, then the Śrāddha of the new moon and other days, being included in the statement of a different performance, would also have to be performed separately.

analyzed: tasmāt tantram eva yuktam
translated: Therefore, combination is proper.

analyzed: atas eva tad tad uttara sātantrya atiti pūrva udāhṛta vacane tantram uktam
translated: For this very reason, in the statement quoted earlier because of the independence of each of those, combination is mentioned.

analyzed: tat ca aṅgānām na tu pradhānasya api ṣoḍaśa saṅkhyā vyāghāta āpattaḥ
translated: And that is for the subsidiaries, not even for the primary, because of the contradiction of the number sixteen.

original: tasmātpatitamāsikaṃ māsikāntaradine taddinamāsikena saha tantreṇa kāryam /
analyzed: tasmāt patita māsikam māsika antara dine tad dina māsikena saha tantreṇa kāryam
translated: Therefore, the monthly Śrāddha that has fallen on another day of the month should be performed in combination with the monthly Śrāddha of that day.

original: ābdikaṃ tu āśaucātirikte pākāsambhavādinā vighne taduttarāmāvāsyādiṣu kāryaṃ na tu āmena /
analyzed: ābdikam tu āśauca atirikte pāka asambhava ādinā vighne tad uttara amāvāsyā ādiṣu kāryam na tu āmena
translated: But the annual Śrāddha should be performed on the subsequent new moon day etc. in the event of an obstacle such as the impossibility of cooking due to impurity, and not with raw food.

analyzed: vyāpannaḥ pi ābdikam na eva kuryāt āmena karhicit
translated: Even one who has suffered misfortune should never perform the annual (Śrāddha) with raw food.

analyzed: annena idam amāyām tu kṛṣṇe vā harivāsare
translated: But this (annual Śrāddha) should be performed with cooked food on the new moon day or on a day sacred to Viṣṇu.

analyzed: iti kārṣṇāṃjinivacanāt
translated: Thus says the text of Kṛṣṇānjina.

analyzed: vyāpannaḥ pāka asambhava ādinā
translated: One who has suffered misfortune (should perform the annual Śrāddha) due to the impossibility of cooking etc.

analyzed: āma niṣedha sāhacaryāt
translated: Because of the association with the prohibition of raw food.

original: vyādhyādinā aśaktena tu putrādidvārā taddina evānnena karaṇīyam /
analyzed: vyādhi ādinā aśaktena tu putra ādi dvārā tad dine eva annena karaṇīyam
translated: But one who is unable due to illness etc. should perform it on that very day through a son or another (relative) with cooked food.

analyzed: anupādeya kāla anurodhena upādeya karttṛ pratinidheḥ nyāyya tvāt
translated: Because it is proper to substitute the performer who is to be accepted in accordance with the time that is to be accepted.

analyzed: yat tu
translated: But this

analyzed: śrāddha vighne dvijātīnām āmaśrāddham prakīrttitam
translated: In an obstruction to a śrāddha, a śrāddha with raw food is prescribed for twice-born people.

analyzed: amāvāsyā ādi niyatam māsa saṃvatsarāt ṛte
translated: It is fixed on the new moon day, except for the month and the year.

original: ekohiṣṭaṃ tu kartavyaṃ pākenaiva sadā svayam /
analyzed: ekohiṣṭam tu kartavyam pākena eva sadā svayam
translated: One should always perform it oneself with cooking alone.

analyzed: abhāve pāka pātrāṇām tat ahar samupoṣayet
translated: In the absence of cooking vessels, one should fast on that day.

analyzed: iti laghu hārīta vacanam
translated: This is the statement of the Lighuhārīta.

analyzed: tat na pratinidhi mātrasya niṣedhakam kintu asagotra pratinidhi niṣedhakam
translated: That does not prohibit a mere substitute, but rather prohibits a substitute of the same gotra.

analyzed: tathā ca preta kriyām adhikṛtya brahmapurāṇe
translated: And in the same way, with regard to the rite for the dead, in the Brahma Purāṇa:

analyzed: na kadācid sagotrāya śrāddham deyam a gautra jaiḥ
translated: The śrāddha should never be given to one of the same gotra by those without gotra.

original: agotrajaiḥ dvārabhūtaiḥ na tu sakṛtkarttṛbhiḥ sagotrāyetyananvayāpatteḥ /
analyzed: agotra jaiḥ dvāra bhūtaiḥ na tu sakṛt karttṛbhiḥ sagotrāya iti ananvaya āpatteḥ
translated: By those without gotra, who are like doors, not by those who perform it once, because it would lead to non-coherence to say to one of the same gotra.

analyzed: atas ca preta śrāddha vikṛti tvāt sāṃvatsarike pi asagotra pratinidhi niṣedhāt tad aikavākya tayā laghu hārīta vacana stha svayam padam asagotra pratiṣedhakam eva
translated: And therefore, because it is a modification of the śrāddha for the dead, even in the annual [śrāddha], since there is a prohibition of a substitute of the same gotra, the word oneself in the statement of the Lighuhārīta is a prohibition of those of the same gotra,

analyzed: śūlapāṇi ādi nibandhāḥ api evam
translated: and the treatises of Śūlapāṇi and others are the same.

analyzed: kecid tu svayam pākena iti anvayam āhuḥ
translated: Some, however, explain the construction as by one's own cooking.

analyzed: abhāvaḥ iti pāka pātra abhāvaḥ pāka sāmagraya bhāva upalakṣakaḥ
translated: Absence here, the absence of the cooking vessel, indicates the absence of the cooking ingredients.

analyzed: tat ahar samupoṣayet
translated: One should fast on that day.

original: iti mukyakālākaraṇanimittaṃ prāyaścittarūpamupoṣaṇaṃ tadahni kartavyamityarthaḥ /🔽śrāddhaṃ punaḥ kṛṣṇaikādaśyādau kāryam /
analyzed: iti mukya kāla akaraṇa nimittam prāyaścitta rūpam upoṣaṇam tat ahni kartavyam iti arthaḥ  śrāddham punar kṛṣṇa ekādaśī ādau kāryam
translated: The meaning is that the fasting, which is an expiation due to the omission of the primary time, should be done on that day.🔽The Śrāddha, on the other hand, should be performed on the eleventh day of the dark fortnight and so on.

analyzed: anyathā pūrva udāhṛta kārṣṇājini vacana virodha āpatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, there would be the fault of contradicting the statement of Kṛṣṇā's son quoted earlier.

analyzed: upanayana ādi kāla atipāte pi prāyaścittam kṛtvā upanayana ādi akaraṇa āpatteḥ ca
translated: And because there would be the fault of not performing the initiation and so on even when the time for them has passed, after performing the expiation.

original: tasmāttadahni upoṣaṇarūpaṃ prāyaścittaṃ kṛtvā kṛṣṇaikādaśyādau punaḥ śrāddhaṃ kāryameva /
analyzed: tasmāt tad ahni upoṣaṇa rūpam prāyaścittam kṛtvā kṛṣṇa ekādaśī ādau punar śrāddham kāryam eva
translated: Therefore, having performed the expiation in the form of fasting on that day, the Śrāddha should be performed again on the eleventh day of the dark fortnight and so on.

analyzed: maithilāḥ tu upoṣaṇam eva śrāddha sthānīyam āhuḥ
translated: But the Mithilās say that fasting itself is equivalent to Śrāddha.

analyzed: tasmāt vyādhi ādinā asambhave putra ādi dvārā kāryam
translated: Therefore, if it is not possible due to illness and so on, it should be done through one's son and so on.

analyzed: bhāryā rajaḥ yoge tu tat ahar eva ātma ādi pavkena annena māsika ādi kāryam
translated: But if the wife is in her menstrual period on that day, the monthly and other Śrāddhas should be performed with food cooked by oneself and so on.

analyzed: yat tu
translated: As for what is said:

original: mṛtāhani tu samprāpte yasya bhāryā rajasvalā /
analyzed: mṛta ahani tu samprāpte yasya bhāryā rajasvalā
translated: When the death anniversary falls while the wife is in her menstrual period,

original: śrāddhaṃ tadā na kartavyaṃ kartavyaṃ pañcame 'hani //
analyzed: śrāddham tadā na kartavyam kartavyam pañcame hani
translated: Then the Śrāddha should not be performed, it should be performed on the fifth day.

analyzed: iti hemādri mādhava ādi likhitam vacanam
translated: This is the statement written by Hemādri, Mādhava, and others.

original: tat yasya mṛtasya śrāddhakartrī bhāryā rajasvaleti vyākhyeyam /
analyzed: tat yasya mṛtasya śrāddha kartrī bhāryā rajasvalā iti vyākhyeyam
translated: That should be explained as the wife of the deceased whose Śrāddha is being performed is menstruating,

original: na tu śrāddhakarturbhāryā rajasvaleti /🔽hemādristu gṛhasthasya bhāryayā sahaiva śrāddhe 'dhikārādrajasvalādaśāyāṃ srayanadhi
analyzed: na tu śrāddha kartuḥ bhāryā rajasvalā iti  hemādriḥ tu gṛhasthasya bhāryayā saha eva śrāddhe dhikārāt rajasvalā daśāyām
translated: but not as the wife of the performer of the Śrāddha is menstruating.🔽However, Hemādri says that since the householder is entitled to perform the Śrāddha along with his wife, when she is menstruating, the prohibition of Śrāddha applies to him,

original: kārāt vyāsajyavṛtterbharttṛgatasyāpyadhikārasya nivṛttatvāttasyāstaddaśāpagama eva śrāddhaṃ kāryam /
analyzed: kārāt vyāsajya vṛtteḥ bharttṛ gatasya api adhikārasya nivṛtta tvāt tasyāḥ tad daśā apagame eva śrāddham kāryam
translated: and since the entitlement belonging to the husband is removed by the general rule, the Śrāddha should be performed only after she has ceased to be in that condition.

analyzed: etat nyāya mūlakam ca mṛta ahani iti vacanam
translated: And this statement on the day of death is based on this reasoning.

analyzed: yat tu  puṣpavatsu api dāreṣu videśa sthaḥ pi anagnikaḥ
translated: As for the statement of Laugākṣi:

analyzed: annena eva ubdikam kuryāt hemnā vāmena na kvacid
translated: Even if the husband is in a foreign country, without fire, he should perform the annual Śrāddha with food alone, never with gold, even if his wife is menstruating.

analyzed: iti laugākṣi vacanam tad adhikṛta bhāryā antara sadbhāva viṣayam iti āha
translated: He says that refers to a case where the wife is entitled to perform the Śrāddha.

analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

analyzed: dampatyoḥ śrāddhe saha adhikāre pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no evidence for the entitlement of the couple to perform the Śrāddha together.

original: na capāṇigrahaṇāddhi sahatvaṃ sarvakarmasuiti vacanaṃ mūlamitivācyam /
analyzed: na ca pāṇigrahaṇāt hi sahatvam sarva karmasu iti vacanam mūlam iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that the basis is the statement And in all rites, the joint performance is not from the taking of the hand.

original: etasya yatra śrautasmārttāgnisādhyeṣu karmasu pramāṇāntareṇa ubhayādhikāro 'vagatastadanuvādakatvena pūrttādiṣviva śrāddhe ubhayādhikāravidhāyakatvābhāvāt
analyzed: etasya yatra śrauta smārtta agni sādhyeṣu karmasu pramāṇa antareṇa ubhaya adhikāraḥ vagataḥ tad anuvādaka tvena pūrtta ādiṣu iva śrāddhe ubhaya adhikāra vidhāyaka tva abhāvāt
translated: Because this is a restatement, like in the pūrta etc., of the joint eligibility that is known by another means of knowledge in rites to be accomplished by the sacred fire mentioned in the Vedas and Smṛtis, and not because it prescribes joint eligibility in the śrāddha.

analyzed: na ca śrāddhasya api agni sādhya tvāt ubhaya ādhikārika tvam iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that the śrāddha also has joint eligibility because it is accomplished by the sacred fire.

analyzed: agni sādhya tve pi adhikārasya vaktum aśakya tvāt
translated: Because even if it is accomplished by the sacred fire, eligibility cannot be stated.

original: mṛtapitrādikasya amāvāsyādāvakaraṇapratyavāyaparihārārthe pitṛpitāmahādigatatṛptyuddhārādiphalārthe vā śrāddhe pitṛtvādyanirūpikāyāstasyā mṛtapitṛkatvābhāvena
analyzed: mṛta pitṛ ādikasya amāvāsyā ādau akaraṇa pratyavāya parihāra arthe pitṛ pitāmaha ādi gata tṛpti uddhāra ādi phala arthe vā śrāddhe pitṛ tva ādi anirūpikāyāḥ tasyāḥ mṛta pitṛka tva abhāvena
translated: Because in the śrāddha for the purpose of avoiding the sin of not performing the rites on the new moon day etc. for the deceased father etc., or for the purpose of the benefit of satisfaction, redemption etc. of the deceased father, grandfather etc., that [śrāddha] which cannot be characterized as having the quality of being the son of a deceased father,

analyzed: adhikāra asambhavāt
translated: there is no possibility of eligibility.

analyzed: na ca ādhāna gata ātmanepada virodhaḥ
translated: And there is no contradiction with the optative ending in the agnihotra.

original: ātmanepadāddhi agnisvāmigataṃ phalaṃ janayantyagnisādhyāni karmāṇi na asvāmigatamityetāvadavagamyate na tu sarvasvāmigataṃ phalaṃ janayanti 🔽iti /
analyzed: ātmanepadāt hi agni svāmi gatam phalam janayanti agni sādhyāni karmāṇi na asvāmi gatam iti etāvat avagamyate na tu sarva svāmi gatam phalam janayanti 🔽iti
translated: Because from the optative ending, it is understood only that rites accomplished by the sacred fire produce a result belonging to the owner of the sacred fire, not to the non-owner, but not that they produce a result belonging to all owners.

original: dampatyormadhye ekasya rogādipīḍitasya tatparihārārthamiṣṭau kriyamāṇāyāṃ tadasambhavāt /
analyzed: dampatyoḥ madhye ekasya roga ādi pīḍitasya tad parihāra artham iṣṭau kriyamāṇāyām tad asambhavāt
translated: When a couple is performing a sacrifice for the sake of avoiding the affliction of one of them by disease etc., because that is not possible.

original: na ca śrāddhāṅgapākasya madhyamapiṇḍaprāśanasya ca patnīsādhyatvāt patnīśabdasya ca yajñasvāmivacanatvāttasyā adhikārābhāve kathaṃ tatkarttṛkatvopapattiritivācyam
analyzed: na ca śrāddha aṅga pākasya madhyama piṇḍa prāśanasya ca patnī sādhya tvāt patnī śabdasya ca yajña svāmi vacana tvāt tasyāḥ adhikāra abhāve katham tad karttṛka tva upapattiḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that since the cooking which is a part of the śrāddha and the eating of the middle piṇḍa are to be accomplished by the wife, and since the word 'wife' denotes the sacrificer's wife, how can the performance of those by her be justified when she has no right to perform the śrāddha,

analyzed: ukta rītyā adhikāra asambhave patnī śabdasya lakṣaṇayā
translated: because, in the manner stated, when the right to perform the śrāddha is not possible, the word 'wife' denotes only the sacrificer's wife by secondary signification.

original: tasmādadhikārasadbhāve pramāṇābhāvāttasyāṃ rajasvalāyāmātmādipavkenānnena tadahareva śrāddhaṃ kāryam /
analyzed: tasmāt adhikāra sadbhāve pramāṇa abhāvāt tasyām rajasvalāyām ātma ādi pavkena annena tat ahar eva śrāddham kāryam
translated: Therefore, in the absence of any proof of the existence of the right to perform the śrāddha, the śrāddha should be performed on that very day with food prepared by herself etc. when she is in her menses.

analyzed: iti śrāddha vighne nirṇayaḥ
translated: Thus the decision regarding the hindrance to śrāddha.

analyzed: atha preta śraddhānām kālāḥ
translated: Now, the times for the śrāddhas for the departed ancestors.

original: tatra tāvat dvividhāni pretaśrāddhāni navāni navamiśrāṇi ca /
analyzed: tatra tāvat dvividhāni preta śrāddhāni navāni nava miśrāṇi ca
translated: To begin with, there are two kinds of śrāddhas for the departed ancestors, the nava and the navamīśra.

analyzed: navaśrāddham daśa ahāni navamiśram tu ṣaṭ ṛtūn
translated: The nava śrāddha is for ten days, the navamīśra is for six seasons.

analyzed: iti smṛteḥ
translated: Thus it is stated in the Smṛti.

analyzed: tena antar daśa aham kriyamāṇānām śrāddhānām navāni iti saṃjñā
translated: Therefore, the śrāddhas performed within ten days are called nava.

analyzed: saṃjñākaraṇam tu cāndrāyaṇam navaśrāddham
translated: But the naming ceremony is the Chandrayana and the Navashraddha.

analyzed: iti prāyaścitta ādi upayoga artham tāni anekavidhāni uktāni hema ādi udāhṛta nāgarakhaṇḍe bhartṛ yajñena
translated: These are mentioned by Bharadvaja in the Nagara Khanda quoted from the gold etc. for the purpose of expiations etc.

original: trīṇi sañcayanasyārthe tāni vai śṛṇu sāmpratam /
analyzed: trīṇi sañcayanasya arthe tāni vai śṛṇu sāmpratam
translated: There are three for the purpose of collecting, listen to them now.

original: yatra sthāne bhavenmṛtyustatra śrāddhaṃ tu kārayet //
analyzed: yatra sthāne bhavet mṛtyuḥ tatra śrāddham tu kārayet
translated: Where death may occur, there the Shraddha should be performed.

original: ekoddiṣṭaṃ tato mārge viśrāmo yatra kāritaḥ /
analyzed: ekoddiṣṭam tatas mārge viśrāmaḥ yatra kāritaḥ
translated: Then on the path, where rest is made, is the Ekoddista.

analyzed: tatas sañcayana sthāne tṛtīyam śrāddham iṣyate
translated: Then in the place of collecting, the third Shraddha is desired.

analyzed: paṃñcame saptame tadvat aṣṭame navame tathā
translated: In the fifth, seventh, likewise in the eighth, ninth,

analyzed: daśama ekādaśe ca eva navaśrāddhāni tāni vai
translated: In the tenth and eleventh, those are the nine Shraddhas.

analyzed: atra ca aikādaśāhikasya api navamiti saṃjñā  uktam ca
translated: And here, even of the eleventh day, the name Navami is used.

analyzed: kātyāyanena
translated: And it is said by Katyayana.

analyzed: caturthe pañcame ca eva navama ekādaśe hani
translated: On the fourth, fifth, ninth and eleventh day,

analyzed: yat tu vai dīyate jantoḥ tat navaśrāddham ucyate
translated: What is given by the living being is said to be the nine Shraddhas.

analyzed: aṅgirāḥ
translated: Angirasa says:

analyzed: prathame hni tṛtīye hni pañcame saptame tathā
translated: On the first day, third day, fifth day, seventh day,

analyzed: navama ekādaśe ca eva ṣaṣ navaśrāddham ucyate
translated: Ninth and eleventh, the six nine Shraddhas are said to be.

analyzed: navamam ca ekādaśam ca iti dvandve iti kāla ādarśaḥ
translated: The ninth and eleventh days are a pair, says Kalādarsha.

analyzed: brahmapurāṇe
translated: In the Brahma Purana:

analyzed: tṛtīye hani kartavyam preta dāha avanau dvijāḥ
translated: On the third day, the funeral rites should be performed in the house, O Brahmins.

analyzed: sūtaka ante gṛhe śrāddham ekoddiṣṭam pracakṣate iti
translated: After the period of impurity, they prescribe the Ekoddista Shraddha in the house.

analyzed: vyāsaḥ
translated: Vyasa says:

analyzed: prathame saptame ca eva navama ekādaśe hani
translated: On the first, seventh, ninth and eleventh days,

analyzed: yat tu vai dīyate jantoḥ tat navaśrāddham ucyate  iti
translated: what is offered to the departed is called the Nava Shraddha.

analyzed: yadi api etāni anekavidhāni tathā api vṛddha vaśiṣṭha uktāni eva
translated: Even though there are many such variations, only those mentioned by Vridhavasishtha are to be followed.

analyzed: prathame hni tṛtīye hni saptame navame tathā
translated: On the first day, the third day, the seventh, the ninth,

analyzed: ekādaśe pañcame hni navaśrāddhāni ṣaḍ tathā
translated: the eleventh, and the fifth day, these six are the Nava Shraddhas.

analyzed: iti sāmpratam śiṣṭa ācāra gocarāṇi
translated: These are the ones followed by the cultured.

analyzed: baudhāyanena tu pañca eva uktāni
translated: But Baudhayana mentions only five.

original: tatrāpi navamadivasakartavyasya navaśrāddhasya vighnādinā vicchede tadekādaśe 'hni kartavyamityuktam /
analyzed: tatra api navama divasa kartavyasya navaśrāddhasya vighna ādinā vicchede tat ekādaśe hni kartavyam iti uktam
translated: Even there, if the Nava Shraddha to be performed on the ninth day is interrupted by obstacles etc., it is said to be performed on the eleventh day.

analyzed: maraṇāt viṣameṣu dineṣu ekaikam navaśrāddham kuryāt ā anavamāt
translated: On uneven days after death, one should perform each Nava Shraddha up to the ninth.

analyzed: yatra navamam vicchidyeta ekādaśe hni tat kuryāt iti
translated: Where the ninth is interrupted, it should be performed on the eleventh day.

analyzed: kāṇvaḥ tu yasya kasya api navaśrāddhasya antarāye uttara samāna tantra tā kartavya tām āha
translated: But Kanva says that if there is an obstacle to any new śrāddha, the subsequent one should be performed as a separate ritual.

analyzed: navaśrāddham māsikam ca yadi antaritam bhavet
translated: If the new śrāddha and the monthly śrāddha are interrupted,

analyzed: tat tat uttara sātantryāt anuṣṭheyam pracakṣate
translated: they declare that it should be performed as a separate ritual for each subsequent one.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: śivasvāmī tu
translated: But Śivasvāmin says:

analyzed: navaśrāddhāni pañca āhuḥ āśvalāyana śākhinaḥ

original: nanupratisaṃvattsaraṃ caivaṃitivacanādādyamṛtatithiṃ gṛhītvā ādyasāṃvatsāṃrekasyāpi ādmāsikavatpravṛttiḥ syāditicet / satyam /
analyzed: nanu pratisaṃvattsaram ca evam iti vacanāt ādyam ṛta tithim gṛhītvā syāt iti ced satyam
translated: But if it is argued that since it is said thus every year, taking the first day of the year, it would apply to one year also like the monthly [rites], beginning with the first month? It is true.

original: ādyamekādaśe 'haniiti māsika iva yadyatra vacanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: ādyam ekādaśe hani iti māsike iva yat yatra vacanam syāt
translated: If there were a statement here like the first [day] on the eleventh day in the monthly [rites],

original: pratyuta tasya dbitīyavatsarādyamṛtatithāvutpannatvādādyamatatithau prāptireva nāstīti dvitīyavatsarādau kriyamāṇamābdikamityucyate tṛtīyavatsarādau
analyzed: pratyuta tasya dbitīya vatsara ādi amṛta tithau utpanna tvāt ādya mata tithau prāptiḥ eva nā asti iti dvitīya vatsara ādau kriyamāṇam ābdikam iti ucyate tṛtīya vatsara ādau
translated: but rather, because it arises on the first day of the second year and so on, there is no attainment at all on the first day of the year, so what is done in the second year and so on is called the annual [rite], and in the third year and so on,

analyzed: tu pratyābdikam iti
translated: it is called the yearly [rite].

analyzed: atas eva uktam
translated: For this very reason it is said
in Smṛtyartasāra:

original: dbitīyasaṃvatsarādāvābdikaṃ tṛtīyasaṃvatsarādau pratyābdi kamiti krama iti /
analyzed: dbitīya saṃvatsara ādau ābdikam tṛtīya saṃvatsara ādau pratyābdikam iti kramaḥ iti
translated: The annual [rite] is from the second year, and the yearly [rite] is from the third year and so on, this is the sequence.

analyzed: nirṇayāmṛte tu  vrāhnaṇam bhojayet ādye hotavyam anale
translated: But in Nirṇayasindhu:🔽One should feed a Brahmin on the first day, or offer oblations in the fire,

analyzed: punar ca bhojayet vipram dvis āvṛttiḥ bhavet iti
translated: and again one should feed a Brahmin, this is the repetition.

analyzed: iti  atas ca ekādaśe hni vidhīyamānam ādyābdikam iti
translated: Thus,🔽what is enjoined on the eleventh day is the first annual [rite].

analyzed: adhika māsapāte adhikam māsikam kāryam
translated: If an extra month occurs, the extra monthly [rite] should be performed.

analyzed: tadā saptadaśa bhavanti
translated: Then there are seventeen [days].

analyzed: ādyam ekādaśe kāryam adhike ca adhikam bhavet
translated: The first should be done in the eleventh year, and in the additional years, it should be done additionally.

analyzed: iti laugākṣi vacanāt
translated: Thus it is stated by Laugākṣi.

analyzed: abdam ambu ghaṭam dadyāt annam vā api su sañcitam
translated: One should give a water pot for a year, or well-accumulated food.

analyzed: saṃvatsare vivṛddhe pi pratimāsam ca māsikam
translated: Even if the year increases, the monthly (offering) is done every month.

analyzed: iti kauthumi smaraṇāt ca
translated: Thus it is remembered by Kautsa.

analyzed: saṃvatsara atireke vai māsāḥ ca eva trayodaśa
translated: In the case of more than a year, and also thirteen months,

analyzed: tasmāt ṛyodaśe śrāddham na kuryāt na upatiṣṭhate
translated: Therefore, the thirteenth śrāddha should not be performed, it does not serve any purpose.

original: iti ṛṣyaśṛṅgavacane trayodaśamāsikasya niṣedhaśravaṇādadhikamāse 'pi māsikavikalpa iti kecit /
analyzed: iti ṛṣyaśṛṅga vacane trayodaśa māsikasya niṣedha śravaṇāt adhika māse māsika vikalpaḥ iti kecid
translated: Thus, because the prohibition of the thirteenth month is heard in the statement of Ṛṣyaśṛṅga, some say that there is an option of the monthly (śrāddha) even in an additional month.

analyzed: vastutas tu etasya amāvāsyā viśeṣa vihita kāmya śrāddha viṣaya tvasya sthāpita tvāt māsika vṛddhiḥ eva yuktā
translated: But in reality, since it has been established that this refers to the optional śrāddha prescribed on this new moon day, the increase of the monthly (śrāddha) is proper.

original: yattu hemādṣādau ṣoḍaśaśrāddhānāṃ prakārāntareṇa gaṇanaṃ sapiṇḍīkaraṇādīnāṃ ca ṣoḍaśaśrāddhāntargatatvenopavarṇanam /
analyzed: yat tu hemādṛś ādau ṣoḍaśa śrāddhānām prakāra antareṇa gaṇanam sapiṇḍīkaraṇa ādīnām ca ṣoḍaśa śrāddha antargata tvena upavarṇanam
translated: As for the calculation of sixteen śrāddhas in a different way in the Hāyāḍa and other (smṛtis), and the description of the sapiṇḍīkaraṇa and other (rites) as included within the sixteen śrāddhas,

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: brahmapurāṇe
translated: In the Brāhma-purāṇa:

original: nṝṇāṃ tu tyaktadehānāṃ śrāddhāḥ ṣoḍaśa sarvadā /
analyzed: nṝṇām tu tyakta dehānām śrāddhāḥ ṣoḍaśa sarvadā
translated: For men who have abandoned their bodies, the śrāddhas are always sixteen.

analyzed: caturthe pañcame ca eva navama ekādaśe tathā
translated: On the fourth, fifth, ninth, and eleventh,

analyzed: tatas dvādaśabhiḥ māsaiḥ śrāddhāḥ dvādaśa saṅkhyayā
translated: Then, for twelve months, the twelve Śrāddhas should be performed.

analyzed: kartavyāḥ śrutitaḥ teṣām tatra viprān ca tarpayet
translated: Having heard about them, one should offer libations to the Brāhmaṇas there.

analyzed: bhaviṣyapurāṇe pi  asthisañcayane śrāddham tri pakṣe māsikāni ca
translated: In the Bhaviṣya Purāṇa also:🔽The Śrāddha for collecting the bones, the monthly Śrāddhas after three fortnights,

analyzed: riktayoḥ ca tathā tithyoḥ pretaśrāddhāni ṣoḍaśa
translated: and the sixteen Śrāddhas for the departed ancestors on the two empty lunar days.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: riktayośca tithyorityekenānhā nyūne ṣaṣṭhe dvādaśe ca māse ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: riktayoḥ ca tithyoḥ iti ekena anhāḥ nyūne ṣaṣṭhe dvādaśe ca māse iti arthaḥ
translated: Some say that the two empty lunar days are the sixth and twelfth months, which are one lunar day less.

analyzed: jātūkarṇyaḥ
translated: Jātūkarṇya:

analyzed: dvādaśa pratimāsyāni ādyam ṣāṇmāsike tathā
translated: The twelve monthly Śrāddhas, the first one after six months,

analyzed: sapiṇḍīkaraṇam ca evam iti etat śrāddhaṣoḍaśam
translated: and the Sapiṇḍīkaraṇa - this is the set of sixteen Śrāddhas.

analyzed: ādyam ekādaśāhikam
translated: The first one is the eleventh-day Śrāddha.

analyzed: ṣāṇmāsike ūna ṣāṇmāsike
translated: The one after six months is the one after less than six months.

analyzed: ekam pūrva ṣaṭka antargatam ūna ṣāṇmāsikam aparam uttara ṣaṭka antargatam ūna ābdikam
translated: One is included in the first set of six, which is the one after less than six months, and the other is included in the second set of six, which is the one after less than one year.

analyzed: tatra yat tāvat sapiṇḍīkaraṇasya ṣoḍaśa śrāddha antargata tva abhidhānam tat bahu smṛti vacaḥ virodhāt asamañjasam iva pratibhāti
translated: Now, as for the statement that the Sapiṇḍīkaraṇa is included in the set of sixteen Śrāddhas, that seems to be inconsistent due to the contradiction with the statements of many Smṛtis.

analyzed: śrāddhāni ṣoḍaśa apa adya vidadhīta sapiṇḍanam
translated: One should perform the sixteen Śrāddhas beginning with the Sapiṇḍīkaraṇa.

analyzed: iti laugākṣi vacanāt
translated: Thus says Laugākṣi.

analyzed: tathā
translated: Similarly:

analyzed: arvāk sapiṇḍīkaraṇāt kuryāt śrāddhāni ṣoḍaśa
translated: Before the Sapindikarana, he should perform sixteen Sraddhas.

analyzed: iti paiṭhīnasi vacanāt
translated: Thus says Paithinas.

analyzed: śrāddhāni ṣoḍaśa a dattvā na eva kuryāt sapiṇḍanam
translated: Without having performed sixteen Sraddhas, one should not perform the Sapindikarana.

analyzed: iti gobhila vacanāt ca sapiṇḍīkaraṇa ādīnām ṣoḍaśa śrāddhebhyaḥ pṛthagbhāvāt
translated: Thus says Gobhila. Therefore, the Sapindikarana and other rites are separate from the sixteen Sraddhas.

analyzed: tasmāt preta tva nivṛtti arthaka tva abhiprāyeṇa tad antarbhāva utkīrttanam tmṛti vākyeṣu draṣṭavyam
translated: Therefore, in the statements about death, the inclusion of those rites should be seen with the intention of the purpose of ending the state of being a preta.

analyzed: tena pūrvokta māsika svarūpa saṅkhyā ānukūlyam śiṣṭā cāraḥ ca anugṛhītaḥ bhavati
translated: By that, the conformity with the nature and number of the monthly rites mentioned earlier and the practice of the learned are favored.

original: viruddhagaṇanasya tu śākhābhadena deśabhedena vā vyavasthā draṣṭavyeti /
analyzed: viruddha gaṇanasya tu śākhā bhadena deśa bhedena vā vyavasthā draṣṭavyā iti
translated: But the arrangement of the conflicting enumeration should be seen either by the difference of branches or by the difference of countries.

original: kṣatriyādibhirapyetadādyaṃ śrāddhaṃ satyapyāśauca ekā daśe 'hanyeva kāryam /
analyzed: kṣatriya ādibhiḥ api etat ādyam śrāddham sati api āśauce ekā daśe hani eva kāryam
translated: Even for Kshatriyas and others, this first Sraddha should be performed on the eleventh day itself, even if there is impurity.

analyzed: āha paiṭhīnasiḥ
translated: Paithinas says:

analyzed: ekādaśe hni yat śrāddham tat sāmānyam udāhṛtam
translated: The Sraddha on the eleventh day is said to be common,

analyzed: caturṇām api varṇānām sūtakam tu pṛthak pṛthak
translated: but the impurity is separate for all four varnas.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: śaṅkhaḥ pi
translated: And Shankha also:

analyzed: ādyam śrāddham aśuddhaḥ u pi kuryāt ekādaśe hani
translated: Even an impure person should perform the first Sraddha on the eleventh day,

analyzed: kartuḥ tātkālikī śuddhiḥ aśuddhaḥ punar eva saḥ
translated: The purity of the performer is temporary, but he is impure again.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: sadyaḥśauca ādau api ādyam śrāddha pa ekādaśe hani eva brāhmaṇa ādibhiḥ sarvaiḥ kāryam
translated: Even in the case of immediate purity, the first śrāddha should be performed on the eleventh day after death by all, including Brahmins.

analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And thus

analyzed: saḥ eva  sadyaḥśauce dātavyam pretasya ekādaśe hani
translated: that itself.🔽Even in the case of immediate purity, the śrāddha should be performed on the eleventh day for the deceased.

analyzed: saḥ eva divasaḥ tasya śrāddha śayyā āsana ādiṣu
translated: That same day is for his śrāddha, bed, seat, etc.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: sadyaḥśauce iti eka aha tri aha āśaucayoḥ upalakṣaṇam
translated: In immediate purity, one day and three days purity are referred to.

original: āhitāgnermaraṇadinā danyasmin dine dāhe sati dāhadinādārabhya navaśrāddhaikādaśāhikatraipakṣikāntāni kuryāt /
analyzed: āhitāgneḥ maraṇa dināt anyasmin dine dāhe sati dāha dināt ārabhya nava śrāddha ekādaśāhika traipakṣika antāni kuryāt
translated: If the cremation is done on a day other than the day of death of one who has established the sacred fires, the nine śrāddhas beginning from the day of cremation should be performed, ending with the eleventh day śrāddha, the three fortnightly śrāddhas, etc.

analyzed: anāhitāgneḥ tu ekāgneḥ niragneḥ vā maraṇa dināt ārabhya
translated: But for one who has not established the sacred fires, or for one with one fire or without fire, they should begin from the day of death.

analyzed: tad ūrdhvāni tu ubhayoḥ api maraṇa ādināt eva  tat āha
translated: But those after that should begin from the day of death for both.

analyzed: kātyāyanaḥ  śrāddham agnimataḥ kāryam dāhāt ekādaśe hani
translated: Kātyāyana says that.🔽For one with the sacred fires, the śrāddha should be performed on the eleventh day after cremation.

analyzed: dhruvāṇi tu prakurvīta pramīta ahani sarvadā
translated: But the regular ones should always be performed on the day of death.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: dhruvāṇi iti traipakṣikāt ūrdhvānām saṃjñā
translated: The term regular ones refers to those after the three fortnightly śrāddhas.

analyzed: ūrdhvam tri pakṣāt yat śrāddham mṛtāhani eva tat bhavet
translated: The śrāddha after three fortnights should be done on the day of death itself.

analyzed: adhas tu kārayet dāhāt āhitāgneḥ dvijanmanaḥ
translated: And below, one should cause the cremation of a twice-born who has the sacred fire.

analyzed: iti jātūkarṇya vacanāt ca
translated: And also because of the statement of Jātukarṇya.

original: agnimata iti bahvagnimān gṛhyate /🔽maraṇādeva kartavyaṃ saṃyogo yasya nāgnibhiḥ /
analyzed: agnimataḥ iti bahu agnimān gṛhyate  maraṇāt eva kartavyam saṃyogaḥ yasya na agnibhiḥ
translated: And having the sacred fire refers to one who has many sacred fires.🔽It should be done from death itself, for one who does not have the sacred fires.

analyzed: dāhāt ūrdhvam aśaucam syāt yasya vaitānikaḥ vidhiḥ
translated: After cremation, there would be impurity for one who has the sacrificial rites.

analyzed: iti śaṅkha vacana eka vākya tā lābhāt
translated: Because of the acquisition of the same sentence as the statement of Śaṅkha.

analyzed: marīciḥ māsikānām mukhya gauṇa ādi kalpam āha
translated: Mārīci states the primary, secondary, etc. options for monthly rites:

original: mukhyaṃ śrāddhaṃ māsi māsi aparyāptāvṛtuṃ prati /
analyzed: mukhyam śrāddham māsi māsi aparyāptau ṛtum prati
translated: The primary śrāddha is monthly, if insufficient, for each season,

analyzed: dvādaśa ahena vā kuryāt eka ahe dvādaśa api vā
translated: or one should perform it in twelve days, or on one day and also in twelve.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: pratimāsaṃ mṛtāhe māsikaṃ śrāddhamiti mukhyaḥ kalpaḥ /🔽aparyāptau pratimāsaṃ śrāddhakaraṇāśaktau ṛtu prati /
analyzed: pratimāsam mṛtāhe māsikam śrāddham iti mukhyaḥ kalpaḥ  a paryāptau pratimāsam śrāddha karaṇa aśaktau ṛtu prati
translated: The primary option is that the monthly śrāddha is on the death anniversary every month.🔽If one is unable to perform the śrāddha every month, then for each season.

original: ṛtoratra cāndrasya saurasya vāsambhavānmāsadvayaśrāddhamagrimamāsi kāryamiti tasyārthaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtoḥ atra cāndrasya saurasya vā asambhavāt māsa dvaya śrāddham agrima māsi kāryam iti tasya arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of that is that the śrāddha for two months should be performed in the next month, because the lunar or solar month is not possible here in the season.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: pūrvamāse mṛtitithimullaṅdhyottaramāse mṛtitithau atikrāntaśrāddhaṃ prāptakālaṃ ca śrāddhaṃ ceti dvayaṃ tatra kāryam /
analyzed: pūrva māse mṛti tithim ullaṅdhya uttara māse mṛti tithau atikrānta śrāddham prāpta kālam ca śrāddham ca iti dvayam tatra kāryam
translated: Having skipped the death anniversary in the previous month, the śrāddha that has passed and the śrāddha that has come due should both be performed on the death anniversary in the next month.

analyzed: kvacid trayam api
translated: In some cases, all three.

original: yathā ekādaśāhe ādyaṃ nirvarttya ūnamāsikaṃ ca svakāle kṛtvā
analyzed: yathā ekādaśa ahe ādyam nirvarttya ūnamāsikam ca sva kāle kṛtvā
translated: For example, in the eleven-day period, having performed the first [śrāddha] and the less than one month [śrāddha] at their proper time,

original: tato dvitīyamāsikaṃ traipakṣikaṃ ca tṛtīyamāsikena saha /
analyzed: tatas dvitīya māsikam traipakṣikam ca tṛtīya māsikena saha
translated: then the second month [śrāddha] and the three-fortnight [śrāddha] together with the third month [śrāddha],

analyzed: caturthamāsikena saha caturtham
translated: together with the fourth month [śrāddha] the fourth [śrāddha],

analyzed: pañcamena saha ṣaṣṭham
translated: together with the fifth [śrāddha] the sixth [śrāddha],

analyzed: ūna ṣāṇmāsikam ca saptamena saha
translated: and the less than six month [śrāddha] together with the seventh [śrāddha],

analyzed: aṣṭamam navamena
translated: the eighth [śrāddha] with the ninth [śrāddha],

analyzed: daśamam ekādaśena
translated: the tenth [śrāddha] with the eleventh [śrāddha],

analyzed: dvādaśa mūnābdikena saha iti pūrvam api uktam nava miśram tu ṣaḍutaram iti
translated: and the twelfth [śrāddha] with the less than one year [śrāddha]. This was said before. But the mixed [śrāddha] is six more [śrāddhas].

analyzed: tasya api ayam eva arthaḥ iti dvitīya kalpaḥ
translated: The meaning of this is the same, so this is the second alternative.

original: atha vā dvādaśāhena dvādaśabhirdinaiḥ apavarge tṛtīyā /
analyzed: atha vā dvādaśa ahena dvādaśabhiḥ dinaiḥ apavarge tṛtīyā
translated: Or, the third alternative is that the end [of the impurity period] is after twelve days, that is, after twelve days.

analyzed: tācadbhiḥ dinaiḥ apavṛttāni dvādaśa māsikāni kāryāṇi  tatra āśauca uttara dine ekādaśa ahe ādyam
translated: The twelve monthly [śrāddhas] should be performed after those days.🔽There, on the day after the impurity period, the first [śrāddha] is performed.

original: tatastaduttaradine tūnādyaṃ dvitīyaṃ ca /🔽tatastaduttaradine traipākṣikaṃ tṛtīyaṃ ca /
analyzed: tatas tad uttara dine tu ūna ādyam dvitīyam ca  tatas tad uttara dine traipākṣikam tṛtīyam ca
translated: Then on the day after that, the second [śrāddha] and the less than one month [śrāddha].🔽Then on the day after that, the third [śrāddha] and the three-fortnight [śrāddha].

analyzed: tatas tad uttareṣu triṣu dineṣu krameṇa caturtha pañcama ṣaṣṭhāni
translated: Then on the next three days, the fourth, fifth, and sixth [śrāddhas] in order.

analyzed: tatas uttara dine tūna ṣāṇmāsike saptamam ca
translated: Then on the next day, the seventh (is performed).

analyzed: tatas tad uttara dineṣu aṣṭama navama daśama ekādaśāni
translated: Then on the subsequent days, the eighth, ninth, tenth, and eleventh (are performed).

analyzed: tatas uttara dine dvādaśa mūnābdikam ca iti
translated: Then on the next day, the twelfth (is performed).

original: dvādaśabhirdinaiḥ ṣoḍaśa śrāddhāni kṛtvā taduttaradine sapiṇḍīkaraṇam /
analyzed: dvādaśabhiḥ dinaiḥ ṣoḍaśa śrāddhāni kṛtvā tad uttara dine sapiṇḍīkaraṇam
translated: Thus, having performed sixteen Śrāddhas in twelve days, on the next day, the Sapindikarana (is performed).

original: śrāddhacintāgaṇau tu dvādaśāhamupakramya dvādaśabhirddinairdvādaśa māsikāni śrāddhāni kṛtvā tataḥ pareha'ni sapiṇḍīkaraṇamityuktam iti tṛtīyakalpaḥ🔽atha vā ekasminneva dine ekāhe ekādaśāhe dva /
analyzed: śrāddha cintā gaṇau tu dvādaśa aham upakramya dvādaśabhiḥ dinaiḥ dvādaśa māsikāni śrāddhāni kṛtvā tatas parehani sapiṇḍīkaraṇam iti uktam iti tṛtīya kalpaḥ  atha vai ekasmin eva dine eka ahe ekādaśa ahe dvau
translated: But the Śrāddha-cintā-gaṇa, beginning with the twelve-day period, says that having performed the twelve monthly Śrāddhas in twelve days, the Sapindikarana is performed after that. This is the third view.

original: daśāhe vā dvādaśāpi māsikāni kṛtvā sapiṇḍīkaraṇaṃ kāryamiti caturthaḥ kalpaḥ /
analyzed: daśa ahe vā dvādaśa api māsikāni kṛtvā sapiṇḍīkaraṇam kāryam iti caturthaḥ kalpaḥ
translated: Or, on the same day, in one day, in eleven days, or in twelve days, all twelve monthly (Śrāddhas) should be performed, and the Sapindikarana should be performed. This is the fourth view.

analyzed: dvādaśa api ṣoḍaśa api iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that twelve or sixteen (Śrāddhas) should be performed.

analyzed: kaṇvaḥ
translated: Kaṇva

analyzed: navaśrāddham māsikam ca yat yat antaritam bhavet
translated: If the Navasrāddha and the monthly (Śrāddha) are interrupted by anything,

analyzed: tat tat uttara sātantryāt anuṣṭheyam pracakṣate
translated: they declare that it should be performed according to the subsequent independence.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: ṛṣyaśṛṅgaḥ
translated: Ṛṣyaśṛṅga

original: ekoddiṣṭe tu samprāpte yadi vivnaḥ grajāyate /

analyzed: kiñca āhitāgnaiḥ daihitrasya vidyamāne niragnau mātule pārvaṇa anuroghena mātāmaha sapiṇḍīkaraṇam prāpnuyāt dauhitra anurodhena vā mātulasya gauṇa kāle
translated: Moreover, for one who has set up the sacred fires, even if the maternal uncle is without fires, the Sapindikarana of the maternal grandfather would be obtained in accordance with the Pārvaṇa rite, or in accordance with the grandson, in the secondary time of the maternal uncle.
